classes.name: BaseClient
classes.description: The base class for all clients.

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys all assets used by the base client.

methods.name: incrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Increments max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

methods.name: decrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Decrements max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information.

events.name: rateLimit
events.description: Emitted when the client hits a rate limit while making a request

params.name: rateLimitData
params.description: Object containing the rate limit info

events.name: apiRequest
events.description: Emitted before every API request.This event can emit several times for the same request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that is about to be sent

events.name: apiResponse
events.description: Emitted after every API request has received a response.This event does not necessarily correlate to completion of the request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that triggered this response

params.name: response
params.description: The response received from the Discord API

events.name: invalidRequestWarning
events.description: Emitted periodically when the process sends invalid requests to let users avoid the10k invalid requests in 10 minutes threshold that causes a ban

params.name: invalidRequestWarningData
params.description: Object containing the invalid request info

classes.name: Client
classes.description: The main hub for interacting with the Discord API, and the starting point for any bot.

props.name: _cleanups
props.description: Functions called when a cache is garbage collected or the Client is destroyed

props.name: _finalizers
props.description: The finalizers used to cleanup items.

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket manager of the client

props.name: actions
props.description: The action manager of the client

props.name: voice
props.description: The voice manager of the client

props.name: voiceStates
props.description: A manager of the voice states of this client (Support DM / Group DM)

props.name: shard
props.description: Shard helpers for the client (only if the process was spawned from a {@link ShardingManager})

props.name: users
props.description: The user manager of this client

props.name: guilds
props.description: A manager of all the guilds the client is currently handling -as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* guild the bot is a member of

props.name: channels
props.description: All of the {@link Channel}s that the client is currently handling -as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* channel in *every* guild the botis a member of. Note that DM channels will not be initially cached, and thus not be presentin the Manager without their explicit fetching or use.

props.name: sweepers
props.description: The sweeping functions and their intervals used to periodically sweep caches

props.name: presence
props.description: The presence of the Client

props.name: presences
props.description: A manager of the presences belonging to this client

props.name: notes
props.description: All of the note that have been cached at any point, mapped by their ids

props.name: relationships
props.description: All of the relationships {@link User}

props.name: billing
props.description: Manages the API methods

props.name: developers
props.description: Manages developer applications

props.name: quests
props.description: Manages quest-related API methods

props.name: sessions
props.description: All of the sessions of the client

props.name: settings
props.description: All of the settings {@link Object}

props.name: token
props.description: Authorization token for the logged in bot.If present, this defaults to `process.env.DISCORD_TOKEN` when instantiating the client<warn>This should be kept private at all times.</warn>

props.name: user
props.description: User that the client is logged in as

props.name: readyAt
props.description: Time at which the client was last regarded as being in the `READY` state(each time the client disconnects and successfully reconnects, this will be overwritten)

props.name: authenticator
props.description: The authenticator used for TOTP

props.name: emojis
props.description: A manager of all the custom emojis that the client has access to

props.name: readyTimestamp
props.description: Timestamp of the time the client was last `READY` at

props.name: uptime
props.description: How long it has been since the client last entered the `READY` state in milliseconds

props.name: sessionId
props.description: The current session id of the shard

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in, establishing a WebSocket connection to Discord.
examples: client.login('my token');

params.name: token
params.description: Token of the account to log in with

returns.description: Token of the account used

methods.name: passLogin
methods.description: Logs the client in, establishing a WebSocket connection to Discord.
examples: client.passLogin("test@gmail.com", "SuperSecretPa$$word", 1234)
methods.deprecated: This method will not be updated until I find the most convenient way to implement MFA.

params.name: email
params.description: The email associated with the account

params.name: password
params.description: The password assicated with the account

returns.description: Token of the account used

methods.name: isReady
methods.description: Returns whether the client has logged in, indicative of being able to accessproperties such as `user` and `application`.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Logs out, terminates the connection to Discord, and destroys the client.

methods.name: logout
methods.description: Logs out, terminates the connection to Discord, destroys the client and destroys the token.

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Obtains an invite from Discord.
examples: client.fetchInvite('https://discord.gg/djs')  .then(invite => console.log(`Obtained invite with code: ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchGuildTemplate
methods.description: Obtains a template from Discord.
examples: client.fetchGuildTemplate('https://discord.new/FKvmczH2HyUf')  .then(template => console.log(`Obtained template with code: ${template.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Obtains a webhook from Discord.
examples: client.fetchWebhook('id', 'token')  .then(webhook => console.log(`Obtained webhook with name: ${webhook.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchVoiceRegions
methods.description: Obtains the available voice regions from Discord.
examples: client.fetchVoiceRegions()  .then(regions => console.log(`Available regions are: ${regions.map(region => region.name).join(', ')}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchSticker
methods.description: Obtains a sticker from Discord.
examples: client.fetchSticker('id')  .then(sticker => console.log(`Obtained sticker with name: ${sticker.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchUserWithBot
methods.description: Fetches a user using a bot token.
examples: client.fetchUserWithBot('123456789012345678', 'Bot YOUR_BOT_TOKEN')  .then(user => console.log(`Fetched user: ${user.tag}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: botToken
params.description: The bot token to use for the request

methods.name: fetchPremiumStickerPacks
methods.description: Obtains the list of sticker packs available to Nitro subscribers from Discord.
examples: client.fetchPremiumStickerPacks()  .then(packs => console.log(`Available sticker packs are: ${packs.map(pack => pack.name).join(', ')}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: _finalize
methods.description: A last ditch cleanup function for garbage collection.

params.name: options.message
params.description: The message to send after a successful GC

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the item being GCed

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description: Sweeps all text-based channels' messages and removes the ones older than the max message lifetime.If the message has been edited, the time of the edit is used rather than the time of the original message.
examples: // Remove all messages older than 1800 seconds from the messages cacheconst amount = client.sweepMessages(1800);console.log(`Successfully removed ${amount} messages from the cache.`);

params.name: lifetime
params.description: Messages that are older than this (in seconds)will be removed from the caches. The default is based on {@link ClientOptions#messageCacheLifetime}

returns.description: Amount of messages that were removed from the caches,or -1 if the message cache lifetime is unlimited

methods.name: fetchGuildPreview
methods.description: Obtains a guild preview from Discord, available for all guilds the bot is in and all Discoverable guilds.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the preview for

methods.name: fetchGuildWidget
methods.description: Obtains the widget data of a guild from Discord, available for guilds with the widget enabled.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the widget data for

methods.name: refreshAttachmentURL
methods.description: Refresh the Discord CDN links with hashes so they can be usable.

methods.name: sleep
methods.description: The sleep function in JavaScript returns a promise that resolves after a specified timeout.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout parameter is the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the sleepfunction will wait before resolving the promise and continuing execution.

returns.description: The `sleep` function is returning a Promise.

methods.name: acceptInvite
methods.description: Join this Guild / GroupDMChannel using this invite
examples: await client.acceptInvite('https://discord.gg/genshinimpact', { bypassOnboarding: true, bypassVerify: true })

methods.name: redeemNitro
methods.description: Redeem nitro from code or url.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel that the code was sent in

methods.name: authorizeURL
methods.description: Authorize an application.

methods.name: installUserApps
methods.description: Install User Apps

methods.name: deauthorize
methods.description: Deauthorizes an application or token.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the Discord Application or Token.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the ID provided. Defaults to 'application'.

returns.description: A promise that resolves when the deauthorization is complete.

methods.name: authorizedApplications
methods.description: Retrieves the list of authorized applications (OAuth2 tokens).

methods.name: _eval
methods.description: Calls {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval} on a scriptwith the client as `this`.

methods.name: _validateOptions
methods.description: Validates the client options.

methods.name: incrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Increments max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

methods.name: decrementMaxListeners
methods.description: Decrements max listeners by one, if they are not zero.

events.name: applicationCommandPermissionsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever permissions for an application command in a guild were updated.<warn>This includes permission updates for other applications in addition to the logged in client,check `data.applicationId` to verify which application the update is for</warn>

events.name: autoModerationActionExecution
events.description: Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule is triggered.<info>This event requires the {@link Permissions.FLAGS.MANAGE_GUILD} permission.</info>
events.deprecated: This event is not received by user accounts.

events.name: autoModerationRuleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule is created.<info>This event requires the {@link Permissions.FLAGS.MANAGE_GUILD} permission.</info>
events.deprecated: This event is not received by user accounts.

events.name: autoModerationRuleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule is deleted.<info>This event requires the {@link Permissions.FLAGS.MANAGE_GUILD} permission.</info>
events.deprecated: This event is not received by user accounts.

events.name: autoModerationRuleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever an auto moderation rule gets updated.<info>This event requires the {@link Permissions.FLAGS.MANAGE_GUILD} permission.</info>
events.deprecated: This event is not received by user accounts.

params.name: oldAutoModerationRule
params.description: The auto moderation rule before the update

params.name: newAutoModerationRule
params.description: The auto moderation rule after the update

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild channel is created.

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is deleted.

events.name: guildAuditLogEntryCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild audit log entry is created.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild where the entry was created

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild kicks the client or the guild is deleted/left.

events.name: emojiCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is created in a guild.

events.name: emojiDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is deleted in a guild.

events.name: emojiUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is updated in a guild.

events.name: guildIntegrationsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild integration is updated

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild whose integrations were updated

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.
events.deprecated: See {@link https://github.com/aiko-chan-ai/djs-selfbot-v13/issues/197 this issue} for more information.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left/been kicked from the guild

events.name: guildMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member changes - i.e. new role, removed role, nickname.
events.deprecated: See {@link https://github.com/aiko-chan-ai/djs-selfbot-v13/issues/197 this issue} for more information.

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available.

events.name: roleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a role is created.

events.name: roleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

events.name: roleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

events.name: guildScheduledEventCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild scheduled event is created.

events.name: guildScheduledEventDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild scheduled event is deleted.

events.name: guildScheduledEventUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild scheduled event gets updated.

params.name: oldGuildScheduledEvent
params.description: The guild scheduled event object before the update

params.name: newGuildScheduledEvent
params.description: The guild scheduled event object after the update

events.name: guildScheduledEventUserAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user subscribes to a guild scheduled event

events.name: guildScheduledEventUserRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a user unsubscribes from a guild scheduled event

events.name: stickerCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom sticker is created in a guild.

events.name: stickerDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom sticker is deleted in a guild.

events.name: stickerUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom sticker is updated in a guild.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

events.name: inviteCreate
events.description: Emitted when an invite is created.<info> This event only triggers if the client has `MANAGE_GUILD` permissions for the guild,or `MANAGE_CHANNELS` permissions for the channel.</info>

events.name: inviteDelete
events.description: Emitted when an invite is deleted.<info> This event only triggers if the client has `MANAGE_GUILD` permissions for the guild,or `MANAGE_CHANNELS` permissions for the channel.</info>

events.name: messageCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created.

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created.

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted.

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk.

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their id

events.name: messagePollVoteAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user votes in a poll.

params.name: pollAnswer
params.description: The answer that was voted on

params.name: userId
params.description: The id of the user that voted

events.name: messagePollVoteRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a user removes their vote in a poll.

params.name: pollAnswer
params.description: The answer where the vote was removed

params.name: userId
params.description: The id of the user that removed their vote

events.name: messageReactionAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is added to a cached message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that applied the guild or reaction emoji

events.name: messageReactionRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is removed from a cached message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user whose emoji or reaction emoji was removed

events.name: messageReactionRemoveAll
events.description: Emitted whenever all reactions are removed from a cached message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message the reactions were removed from

params.name: reactions
params.description: The cached message reactions that were removed.

events.name: messageReactionRemoveEmoji
events.description: Emitted when a bot removes an emoji reaction from a cached message.

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member's presence (e.g. status, activity) is changed.

params.name: oldPresence
params.description: The presence before the update, if one at all

events.name: stageInstanceCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance is created.

events.name: stageInstanceDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance is deleted.

events.name: stageInstanceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance gets updated - e.g. change in topic or privacy level

params.name: oldStageInstance
params.description: The stage instance before the update

params.name: newStageInstance
params.description: The stage instance after the update

events.name: threadCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is created or when the client user is added to a thread.

params.name: newlyCreated
params.description: Whether the thread was newly created

events.name: threadDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is deleted.

events.name: threadListSync
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user gains access to a text or news channel that contains threads

events.name: threadMembersUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever members are added or removed from a thread. Requires `GUILD_MEMBERS` privileged intent

events.name: threadMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user's thread member is updated.

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel.

events.name: userUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user's details (e.g. username) are changed.Triggered by the Discord gateway events USER_UPDATE, GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE, and PRESENCE_UPDATE.

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a member changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldState
params.description: The voice state before the update

params.name: newState
params.description: The voice state after the update

events.name: webhookUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel has its webhooks changed.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that had a webhook update

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted for general warnings.

events.name: guildMemberSpeaking
events.description: Emitted once a guild member changes speaking state.

params.name: speaking
params.description: The speaking state of the member

events.name: applicationCommandCreate
events.description: Emitted when a guild application command is created.
events.deprecated: See {@link https://github.com/discord/discord-api-docs/issues/3690 this issue} for more information.

events.name: applicationCommandDelete
events.description: Emitted when a guild application command is deleted.
events.deprecated: See {@link https://github.com/discord/discord-api-docs/issues/3690 this issue} for more information.

events.name: applicationCommandUpdate
events.description: Emitted when a guild application command is updated.
events.deprecated: See {@link https://github.com/discord/discord-api-docs/issues/3690 this issue} for more information.

events.name: callCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever received a call

events.name: callDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever delete a call

events.name: callUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever update a call

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the pins of a channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event,not much information can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occurred in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: channelRecipientAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a recipient is added from a group DM.

events.name: channelRecipientRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a recipient is removed from a group DM.

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change, channel type change.

events.name: guildAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes available.

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a guild.

events.name: guildMemberAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user joins a guild.
events.deprecated: See {@link https://github.com/aiko-chan-ai/djs-selfbot-v13/issues/197 this issue} for more information.

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of guild members is received (all members come from the same guild).

params.name: guild

events.name: interactionModalCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever client user receive interaction.showModal()

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

events.name: relationshipAdd
events.description: Emitted when a relationship is created, relevant to the current user.

params.name: shouldNotify
params.description: Whether the client should notify the user of this relationship's creation

events.name: relationshipRemove
events.description: Emitted when a relationship is removed, relevant to the current user.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the old relationship

params.name: nickname
params.description: The nickname of the user in this relationship (1-32 characters)

events.name: relationshipUpdate
events.description: Emitted when a relationship is updated, relevant to the current user (e.g. friend nickname changed).<info>This is not sent when the type of a relationship changes; see {@link Client#relationshipAdd} and {@link Client#relationshipRemove} for that.</info>

events.name: shardResume
events.description: Emitted when a shard resumes successfully.

events.name: threadUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is updated - e.g. name change, archive state change, locked state change.

events.name: voiceChannelEffectSend
events.description: Emmited when someone sends an effect, such as an emoji reaction, in a voice channel the client is connected to.

events.name: shardReady
events.description: Emitted when a shard turns ready.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard id that turned ready

params.name: unavailableGuilds
params.description: Set of unavailable guild ids, if any

events.name: shardDisconnect
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket disconnects and will no longer reconnect.

events.name: shardReconnecting
events.description: Emitted when a shard is attempting to reconnect or re-identify.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard id that is attempting to reconnect

events.name: invalidated
events.description: Emitted when the client's session becomes invalidated.You are expected to handle closing the process gracefully and preventing a boot loopif you are listening to this event.

events.name: unhandledPacket
events.description: Emitted whenever a packet isn't handled.

params.name: shard
params.description: The shard that received the packet (Shard 0)

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the client becomes ready to start working.

events.name: shardError
events.description: Emitted whenever a shard's WebSocket encounters a connection error.

params.name: shardId
params.description: The shard that encountered this error

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when the client encounters an error.<warn>Errors thrown within this event do not have a catch handler, it isrecommended to not use async functions as `error` event handlers. See the[Node.js docs](https://nodejs.org/api/events.html#capture-rejections-of-promises) for details.</warn>

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information.

events.name: rateLimit
events.description: Emitted when the client hits a rate limit while making a request

params.name: rateLimitData
params.description: Object containing the rate limit info

events.name: apiRequest
events.description: Emitted before every API request.This event can emit several times for the same request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that is about to be sent

events.name: apiResponse
events.description: Emitted after every API request has received a response.This event does not necessarily correlate to completion of the request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that triggered this response

params.name: response
params.description: The response received from the Discord API

events.name: invalidRequestWarning
events.description: Emitted periodically when the process sends invalid requests to let users avoid the10k invalid requests in 10 minutes threshold that causes a ban

params.name: invalidRequestWarningData
params.description: Object containing the invalid request info

classes.name: ClientVoiceManager
classes.description: Manages voice connections for the clientFeat: Support both lib & djs/voice

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this voice manager

props.name: connection
props.description: A current connection objects

props.name: adapters
props.description: Maps guild ids to voice adapters created for use with @discordjs/voice.

methods.name: joinChannel
methods.description: Sets up a request to join a voice channel.

classes.name: AudioDispatcher
classes.description: The class that sends voice packet data to the voice connection.```js// Obtained using:client.voice.joinChannel(channel).then(connection => {  // You can play a file or a stream here:  const dispatcher = connection.playAudio('/home/hydrabolt/audio.mp3');});```

props.name: bitrateEditable
props.description: Whether or not the Opus bitrate of this stream is editable

props.name: volumeEditable
props.description: Whether or not the volume of this stream is editable

props.name: volume
props.description: The current volume of the stream

props.name: volumeDecibels
props.description: The current volume of the stream in decibels

props.name: volumeLogarithmic
props.description: The current volume of the stream from a logarithmic scale

props.name: player
props.description: The Player that controls this dispatcher

props.name: pausedSince
props.description: The time that the stream was paused at (null if not paused)

props.name: paused
props.description: Whether or not playback is paused

props.name: pausedTime
props.description: Total time that this dispatcher has been paused in milliseconds

props.name: totalStreamTime
props.description: The time (in milliseconds) that the dispatcher has been playing audio for, taking into account skips and pauses

methods.name: getTypeDispatcher
methods.description: Get the type of the dispatcher

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Set the bitrate of the current Opus encoder if using a compatible Opus stream.

params.name: value
params.description: New bitrate, in kbpsIf set to 'auto', the voice channel's bitrate will be used

returns.description: true if the bitrate has been successfully changed.

methods.name: setPLP
methods.description: Sets the expected packet loss percentage if using a compatible Opus stream.

returns.description: Returns true if it was successfully set.

methods.name: setFEC
methods.description: Enables or disables forward error correction if using a compatible Opus stream.

returns.description: Returns true if it was successfully set.

classes.name: WebhookClient
classes.description: The webhook client.

props.name: id
props.description: The webhook's id

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the webhook was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the webhook was created at

props.name: url
props.description: The URL of this webhook

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message with this webhook.
examples: // Send a basic messagewebhook.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a basic message in a threadwebhook.send({ content: 'hello!', threadId: '836856309672348295' })  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filewebhook.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Send a local filewebhook.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send an embed with a local image insidewebhook.send({  content: 'This is an embed',  embeds: [{    thumbnail: {         url: 'attachment://file.jpg'      }   }],   files: [{      attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',      name: 'file.jpg'   }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendSlackMessage
methods.description: Sends a raw slack message with this webhook.
examples: // Send a slack messagewebhook.sendSlackMessage({  'username': 'Wumpus',  'attachments': [{    'pretext': 'this looks pretty cool',    'color': '#F0F',    'footer_icon': 'http://snek.s3.amazonaws.com/topSnek.png',    'footer': 'Powered by sneks',    'ts': Date.now() / 1_000  }]}).catch(console.error);

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this webhook.

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Gets a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: message
params.description: The id of the message to fetch

params.name: cacheOrOptions
params.description: The options to provide to fetch the message.<warn>A **deprecated** boolean may be passed instead to specify whether to cache the message.</warn>

returns.description: Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: editMessage
methods.description: Edits a message that was sent by this webhook.

returns.description: Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

events.name: apiRequest
events.description: Emitted before every API request.This event can emit several times for the same request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

params.name: request
params.description: The request that is about to be sent

events.name: apiResponse
events.description: Emitted after every API request has received a response.This event does not necessarily correlate to completion of the request, e.g. when hitting a rate limit.<info>This is an informational event that is emitted quite frequently,it is highly recommended to check `request.path` to filter the data.</info>

events.description: Emitted periodically when the process sends invalid requests to let users avoid the10k invalid requests in 10 minutes threshold that causes a ban

params.description: Object containing the invalid request info

methods.description: Adds a packet to the queue to be sent to the gateway.<warn>If you use this method, make sure you understand that you need to providea full [Payload](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway-events#payload-structure).Do not use this method if you don't know what you're doing.</warn>

params.name: important
params.description: If this packet should be added first in queue

methods.description: Sends data, bypassing the queue.

methods.description: Destroys this shard and closes its WebSocket connection.

params.default: { closeCode: 1000, reset: false, emit: true, log: true }

methods.description: Cleans up the WebSocket connection listeners.

events.description: Emitted when the shard is fully ready.This event is emitted if:* all guilds were received by this shard* the ready timeout expired, and some guilds are unavailable

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Emitted when a shard is destroyed, but no WebSocket connection was present.

classes.name: ApplicationCommandManager
classes.description: Manages API methods for application commands and stores their cache.

props.name: permissions
props.description: The manager for permissions of arbitrary commands on arbitrary guilds

props.name: cache
props.description: The cache of this manager

props.name: _cache
props.description: The private cache of items for this manager.

props.description: The data structure belonging to this manager.

props.description: The client that instantiated this Manager

methods.name: commandPath
methods.description: The APIRouter path to the commands

params.name: options.guildId
params.description: The guild's id to use in the path,ignored when using a {@link GuildApplicationCommandManager}

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Obtains one or multiple application commands from Discord, or the cache if it's already available.
examples: // Fetch a single commandclient.application.commands.fetch('123456789012345678')  .then(command => console.log(`Fetched command ${command.name}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch all commandsguild.commands.fetch()  .then(commands => console.log(`Fetched ${commands.size} commands`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates an application command.
examples: // Create a new commandclient.application.commands.create({  name: 'test',  description: 'A test command',})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: guildId
params.description: The guild's id to create this command in,ignored when using a {@link GuildApplicationCommandManager}

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets all the commands for this application or guild.
examples: // Set all commands to just this oneclient.application.commands.set([  {    name: 'test',    description: 'A test command',  },])  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Remove all commandsguild.commands.set([])  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: guildId
params.description: The guild's id to create the commands in,ignored when using a {@link GuildApplicationCommandManager}

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits an application command.
examples: // Edit an existing commandclient.application.commands.edit('123456789012345678', {  description: 'New description',})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the command with

params.name: guildId
params.description: The guild's id where the command registered,ignored when using a {@link GuildApplicationCommandManager}

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes an application command.
examples: // Delete a commandguild.commands.delete('123456789012345678')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: guildId
params.description: The guild's id where the command is registered,ignored when using a {@link GuildApplicationCommandManager}

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves a data entry to a data Object.

params.description: The id or instance of something in this Manager

returns.description: An instance from this Manager

methods.description: Resolves a data entry to an instance id.

params.name: idOrInstance
params.description: The id or instance of something in this Manager

methods.description: Transforms an {@link ApplicationCommandData} object into something that can be used with the API.

classes.name: ApplicationCommandPermissionsManager
classes.description: Manages API methods for permissions of Application Commands.

props.name: manager
props.description: The manager or command that this manager belongs to

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild that this manager acts on

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild that this manager acts on

props.name: commandId
props.description: The id of the command this manager acts on

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Manager

methods.name: permissionsPath
methods.description: The APIRouter path to the commands

params.name: guildId
params.description: The guild's id to use in the path,

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches the permissions for one or multiple commands.
examples: // Fetch permissions for one commandguild.commands.permissions.fetch({ command: '123456789012345678' })  .then(perms => console.log(`Fetched permissions for ${perms.length} users`))  .catch(console.error);

// Fetch permissions for all commands in a guildclient.application.commands.permissions.fetch({ guild: '123456789012345678' })  .then(perms => console.log(`Fetched permissions for ${perms.size} commands`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the permissions for one or more commands.
examples: // Set the permissions for one commandclient.application.commands.permissions.set({ guild: '892455839386304532', command: '123456789012345678', permissions: [   {     id: '876543210987654321',     type: 'USER',     permission: false,   },]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Set the permissions for all commandsguild.commands.permissions.set({ fullPermissions: [  {    id: '123456789012345678',    permissions: [{      id: '876543210987654321',      type: 'USER',      permission: false,    }],  },]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: add
methods.description: Add permissions to a command.
examples: // Block a role from the command permissionsguild.commands.permissions.add({ command: '123456789012345678', permissions: [  {    id: '876543211234567890',    type: 'ROLE',    permission: false  },]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Remove permissions from a command.
examples: // Remove a user permission from this commandguild.commands.permissions.remove({ command: '123456789012345678', users: '876543210123456789' })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Remove multiple roles from this commandguild.commands.permissions.remove({  command: '123456789012345678', roles: ['876543210123456789', '765432101234567890']})   .then(console.log)   .catch(console.error);

methods.name: has
methods.description: Check whether a permission exists for a user or role
examples: // Check whether a user has permission to use a commandguild.commands.permissions.has({ command: '123456789012345678', permissionId: '876543210123456789' }) .then(console.log) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: transformPermissions
methods.description: Transforms an {@link ApplicationCommandPermissionData} object into something that can be used with the API.

params.name: received
params.description: Whether these permissions have been received from Discord

classes.name: DeveloperManager
classes.description: Manages API methods for developer applications and provides utilities you might need.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Manager

methods.name: get
methods.description: Fetches all applications owned by the current user
examples: // Fetch all developer applicationsclient.developers.get()  .then(applications => console.log(`Found ${applications.size} applications`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: list
methods.description: Alias for get() method

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches a specific application by ID
examples: // Fetch a specific applicationclient.developers.fetch('1234567890123456789')  .then(app => console.log(`Application: ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: applicationId
params.description: The ID of the application to fetch

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits an application
examples: // Edit an applicationclient.developers.edit('1234567890123456789', {  name: 'My New Bot Name',  description: 'A cool bot description',  tags: ['utility', 'moderation']})  .then(app => console.log(`Updated: ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: applicationId
params.description: The ID of the application to edit

params.name: data
params.description: The data to edit the application with

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Sets the avatar of an application
examples: // Set application avatarclient.developers.setAvatar('1234567890123456789', './avatar.png')  .then(app => console.log(`Updated avatar for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets the name of an application
examples: // Set application nameclient.developers.setName('1234567890123456789', 'My Cool Bot')  .then(app => console.log(`Renamed to ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Sets the description of an application
examples: // Set application descriptionclient.developers.setDescription('1234567890123456789', 'A helpful utility bot')  .then(app => console.log(`Updated description for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setTags
methods.description: Sets the tags of an application (max 5 tags)
examples: // Set application tagsclient.developers.setTags('1234567890123456789', ['utility', 'moderation', 'fun'])  .then(app => console.log(`Updated tags for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: addTag
methods.description: Adds a tag to an application
examples: // Add a tag to applicationclient.developers.addTag('1234567890123456789', 'music')  .then(app => console.log(`Added tag to ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: delTag
methods.description: Removes a tag from an application
examples: // Remove a tag from applicationclient.developers.delTag('1234567890123456789', 'music')  .then(app => console.log(`Removed tag from ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: enableIntents
methods.description: Enables intents for a bot application
examples: // Enable intents for botclient.developers.enableIntents('1234567890123456789')  .then(app => console.log(`Enabled intents for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: disableIntents
methods.description: Disables intents for a bot application
examples: // Disable intents for botclient.developers.disableIntents('1234567890123456789')  .then(app => console.log(`Disabled intents for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

classes.name: GuildBanManager
classes.description: Manages API methods for GuildBans and stores their cache.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild this Manager belongs to

props.name: cache
props.description: The cache of this Manager

props.name: _cache
props.description: The private cache of items for this manager.

props.name: holds
props.description: The data structure belonging to this manager.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Manager

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves a GuildBanResolvable to a GuildBan object.

params.name: ban
params.description: The ban that is in the guild

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches ban(s) from Discord.
examples: // Fetch multiple bans from a guildguild.bans.fetch()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a maximum of 5 bans from a guild without cachingguild.bans.fetch({ limit: 5, cache: false })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a single banguild.bans.fetch('351871113346809860')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a single ban without checking cacheguild.bans.fetch({ user, force: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Fetch a single ban without cachingguild.bans.fetch({ user, cache: false })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: create
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.
examples: // Ban a user by id (or with a user/guild member object)guild.bans.create('84484653687267328')  .then(banInfo => console.log(`Banned ${banInfo.user?.tag ?? banInfo.tag ?? banInfo}`))  .catch(console.error);

returns.description: Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannotbe resolved, the user id will be the result.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Unbans a user from the guild.
examples: // Unban a user by id (or with a user/guild member object)guild.bans.remove('84484653687267328')  .then(user => console.log(`Unbanned ${user.username} from ${guild.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: bulkCreate
methods.description: Bulk ban users from a guild, and optionally delete previous messages sent by them.
examples: // Bulk ban users by ids (or with user/guild member objects) and delete all their messages from the past 7 daysguild.bans.bulkCreate(['84484653687267328'], { deleteMessageSeconds: 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 })  .then(result => {    console.log(`Banned ${result.bannedUsers.length} users, failed to ban ${result.failedUsers.length} users.`)  })  .catch(console.error);
methods.deprecated: This method will not be usable until an effective MFA implementation is in place.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for bulk banning users

returns.description: Returns an object with `bannedUsers` key containing the IDs of the banned usersand the key `failedUsers` with the IDs that could not be banned or were already banned.

methods.name: resolveId
methods.description: Resolves a data entry to an instance id.

params.name: idOrInstance
params.description: The id or instance of something in this Manager

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new channel in the guild.
examples: // Create a new text channelguild.channels.create('new-general', { reason: 'Needed a cool new channel' })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Create a new channel with permission overwritesguild.channels.create('new-voice', {  type: 'GUILD_VOICE',  permissionOverwrites: [     {       id: message.author.id,       deny: [Permissions.FLAGS.VIEW_CHANNEL],    },  ],})

params.name: options

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelguild.channels.createWebhook('222197033908436994', 'Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to create the webhook for

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

methods.name: addFollower
methods.description: Adds the target channel to a channel's followers.

params.description: The channel where published announcements will be posted at

returns.description: Returns created target webhook id.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the channel.

params.name: data

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Sets a new position for the guild channel.
examples: // Set a new channel positionguild.channels.setPosition('222078374472843266', 2)  .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new position is ${newChannel.position}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to set the position for

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the guild channel

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Obtains one or more guild channels from Discord, or the channel cache if they're already available.
examples: // Fetch all channels from the guild (excluding threads)message.guild.channels.fetch()  .then(channels => console.log(`There are ${channels.size} channels.`))  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a single channelmessage.guild.channels.fetch('222197033908436994')  .then(channel => console.log(`The channel name is: ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhooksguild.channels.fetchWebhooks('769862166131245066')  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to fetch webhooks for

methods.name: setPositions
methods.description: Batch-updates the guild's channels' positions.<info>Only one channel's parent can be changed at a time</info>
examples: guild.channels.setPositions([{ channel: channelId, position: newChannelIndex }])  .then(guild => console.log(`Updated channel positions for ${guild}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel.
examples: // Delete the channelguild.channels.delete('858850993013260338', 'making room for new channels')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

classes.name: GuildMemberManager
classes.description: Manages API methods for GuildMembers and stores their cache.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild this manager belongs to

props.name: cache
props.description: The cache of this Manager

props.name: me
props.description: The client user as a GuildMember of this guild

props.name: _cache
props.description: The private cache of items for this manager.

props.name: holds
props.description: The data structure belonging to this manager.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Manager

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves a {@link GuildMemberResolvable} to a {@link GuildMember} object.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that is part of the guild

methods.name: resolveId
methods.description: Resolves a {@link GuildMemberResolvable} to a member id.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that is part of the guild

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds a user to the guild using OAuth2. Requires the `CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE` permission.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to add to the guild

params.name: options
params.description: Options for adding the user to the guild

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches member(s) from Discord, even if they're offline.
examples: // Fetch all members from a guildguild.members.fetch()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a single memberguild.members.fetch('66564597481480192')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a single member without checking cacheguild.members.fetch({ user, force: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Fetch a single member without cachingguild.members.fetch({ user, cache: false })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch by an array of users including their presencesguild.members.fetch({ user: ['66564597481480192', '191615925336670208'], withPresences: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch by queryguild.members.fetch({ query: 'hydra', limit: 1 })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: If a UserResolvable, the user to fetch.If undefined, fetches all members.If a query, it limits the results to users with similar usernames.

methods.name: fetchMe
methods.description: Fetches the client user as a GuildMember of the guild.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for fetching the member

methods.name: search
methods.description: Searches for members in the guild based on a query.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits a member of the guild.<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>

params.name: data
params.description: The data to edit the member with

methods.name: prune
methods.description: Prunes members from the guild based on how long they have been inactive.
examples: // See how many members will be prunedguild.members.prune({ dry: true })  .then(pruned => console.log(`This will prune ${pruned} people!`))  .catch(console.error);
// Actually prune the membersguild.members.prune({ days: 1, reason: 'too many people!' })  .then(pruned => console.log(`I just pruned ${pruned} people!`))  .catch(console.error);
// Include members with a specified roleguild.members.prune({ days: 7, roles: ['657259391652855808'] })   .then(pruned => console.log(`I just pruned ${pruned} people!`))   .catch(console.error);

returns.description: The number of members that were/will be kicked

methods.name: kick
methods.description: Kicks a user from the guild.<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>
examples: // Kick a user by id (or with a user/guild member object)guild.members.kick('84484653687267328')  .then(kickInfo => console.log(`Kicked ${kickInfo.user?.tag ?? kickInfo.tag ?? kickInfo}`))  .catch(console.error);

returns.description: Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannotbe resolved, the user's id will be the result.

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.
examples: // Ban a user by id (or with a user/guild member object)guild.members.ban('84484653687267328')  .then(banInfo => console.log(`Banned ${banInfo.user?.tag ?? banInfo.tag ?? banInfo}`))  .catch(console.error);

returns.description: Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannotbe resolved, the user id will be the result.Internally calls the GuildBanManager#create method.

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a user from the guild. Internally calls the {@link GuildBanManager#remove} method.
examples: // Unban a user by id (or with a user/guild member object)guild.members.unban('84484653687267328')  .then(user => console.log(`Unbanned ${user.username} from ${guild.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

returns.description: The user that was unbanned

methods.name: addRole
methods.description: Adds a role to a member.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to add the role from

methods.name: removeRole
methods.description: Removes a role from a member.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to remove the role from

methods.name: fetchByMemberSafety
methods.description: Experimental method to fetch members from the guild.<info>Lists up to 10000 members of the guild.</info>

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout for receipt of members in ms

methods.name: bulkBan
methods.description: Bulk ban users from a guild, and optionally delete previous messages sent by them.
examples: // Bulk ban users by ids (or with user/guild member objects) and delete all their messages from the past 7 daysguild.members.bulkBan(['84484653687267328'], { deleteMessageSeconds: 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 })  .then(result => {    console.log(`Banned ${result.bannedUsers.length} users, failed to ban ${result.failedUsers.length} users.`)  })  .catch(console.error);
methods.deprecated: This method will not be usable until an effective MFA implementation is in place.

// Create a new private threadchannel.threads  .create({     name: 'mod-talk',     autoArchiveDuration: 60,     type: 'GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD',     reason: 'Needed a separate thread for moderation',   })  .then(threadChannel => console.log(threadChannel))  .catch(console.error);

methods.description: Gets a message, or messages, from this channel.<info>The returned Collection does not contain reaction users of the messages if they were not cached.Those need to be fetched separately in such a case.</info>
examples: // Get messagechannel.messages.fetch('99539446449315840')  .then(message => console.log(message.content))  .catch(console.error);

classes.name: RoleManager
classes.description: Manages API methods for roles and stores their cache.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild belonging to this manager

props.name: cache
props.description: The role cache of this manager

props.name: everyone
props.description: The `@everyone` role of the guild

props.name: premiumSubscriberRole
props.description: The premium subscriber role of the guild, if any

props.name: highest
props.description: The role with the highest position in the cache

props.name: _cache
props.description: The private cache of items for this manager.

props.name: holds
props.description: The data structure belonging to this manager.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Manager

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Obtains a role from Discord, or the role cache if they're already available.
examples: // Fetch all roles from the guildmessage.guild.roles.fetch()  .then(roles => console.log(`There are ${roles.size} roles.`))  .catch(console.error);
// Fetch a single rolemessage.guild.roles.fetch('222078108977594368')  .then(role => console.log(`The role color is: ${role.colors.primaryColor}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchMemberCounts
methods.description: Fetches the member counts for each role in the guild.

methods.name: fetchMemberIds
methods.description: Fetches the member ids for a role in the guild.<info>This only returns 100 member ids</info>

params.name: role
params.description: The role to fetch member ids for

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves a {@link RoleResolvable} to a {@link Role} object.

methods.name: resolveId
methods.description: Resolves a {@link RoleResolvable} to a {@link Role} id.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild with given information.<warn>The position will silently reset to 1 if an invalid one is provided, or none.</warn>
examples: // Create a new roleguild.roles.create()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Create a new role with data and a reasonguild.roles.create({  name: 'Super Cool Blue People',  colors: {    primaryColor: 'BLUE',  },  reason: 'we needed a role for Super Cool People',})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Create a role with holographic colorsguild.roles.create({  name: 'Holographic Role',  reason: 'Creating a role with holographic effect',  colors: {    primaryColor: Constants.HolographicStyles.PRIMARY,    secondaryColor: Constants.HolographicStyles.SECONDARY,    tertiaryColor: Constants.HolographicStyles.TERTIARY,  },})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for creating the new role

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits a role of the guild.
examples: // Edit a roleguild.roles.edit('222079219327434752', { name: 'buddies' })  .then(updated => console.log(`Edited role name to ${updated.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The new data for the role

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a role.
examples: // Delete a roleguild.roles.delete('222079219327434752', 'The role needed to go')  .then(() => console.log('Deleted the role.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Sets the new position of the role.
examples: // Set the position of the roleguild.roles.setPosition('222197033908436994', 1)  .then(updated => console.log(`Role position: ${updated.position}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: role
params.description: The role to change the position of

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the role

methods.name: setPositions
methods.description: Batch-updates the guild's role positions
examples: guild.roles.setPositions([{ role: roleId, position: updatedRoleIndex }]) .then(guild => console.log(`Role positions updated for ${guild}`)) .catch(console.error);

methods.name: comparePositions
methods.description: Compares the positions of two roles.

classes.name: Shard
classes.description: A self-contained shard created by the {@link ShardingManager}. Each one has a {@link ChildProcess} that containsan instance of the bot and its {@link Client}. When its child process/worker exits for any reason, the shard willspawn a new one to replace it as necessary.

props.description: Manager that created the shard

props.description: The shard's id in the manager

props.description: Arguments for the shard's process executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: env
props.description: Environment variables for the shard's process, or workerData for the shard's worker

props.name: ready
props.description: Whether the shard's {@link Client} is ready

props.name: process
props.description: Process of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: worker
props.description: Worker of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `worker`)

props.name: _evals
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#eval}, mapped by the `script` they were called with

props.name: _fetches
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#fetchClientValue}, mapped by the `prop` they were called with

props.name: _exitListener
props.description: Listener function for the {@link ChildProcess}' `exit` event

methods.description: Forks a child process or creates a worker thread for the shard.<warn>You should not need to call this manually.</warn>

params.name: timeout
params.description: The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client} has become readybefore resolving (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

methods.name: kill
methods.description: Immediately kills the shard's process/worker and does not restart it.

methods.name: respawn
methods.description: Kills and restarts the shard's process/worker.

methods.description: Sends a message to the shard's process/worker.

params.description: Message to send to the shard

examples: shard.fetchClientValue('guilds.cache.size')  .then(count => console.log(`${count} guilds in shard ${shard.id}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: prop
params.description: Name of the client property to get, using periods for nesting

methods.description: Evaluates a script or function on the shard, in the context of the {@link Client}.

params.description: JavaScript to run on the shard

returns.description: Result of the script execution

methods.description: Handles a message received from the child process/worker.

methods.description: Handles the shard's process/worker exiting.

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description: This is a utility class that makes multi-process sharding of a bot an easy and painless experience.It works by spawning a self-contained {@link ChildProcess} or {@link Worker} for each individual shard, eachcontaining its own instance of your bot's {@link Client}. They all have a line of communication with the masterprocess, and there are several useful methods that utilize it in order to simplify tasks that are normally difficultwith sharding. It can spawn a specific number of shards or the amount that Discord suggests for the bot, and takes apath to your main bot script to launch for each one.

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

props.name: file
props.description: Path to the shard script file

props.name: shardList
props.description: List of shards this sharding manager spawns

props.name: totalShards
props.description: Amount of shards that all sharding managers spawn in total

props.name: mode
props.description: Mode for shards to spawn with

props.name: respawn
props.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

props.name: shardArgs
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to shards (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: execArgv
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to the executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for obtaining the automatic shard count, and passing to shards

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

methods.name: createShard
methods.description: Creates a single shard.<warn>Using this method is usually not necessary if you use the spawn method.</warn>

params.name: id
params.description: Id of the shard to create<info>This is usually not necessary to manually specify.</info>

returns.description: Note that the created shard needs to be explicitly spawned using its spawn method.

methods.name: spawn
methods.description: Spawns multiple shards.

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Sends a message to all shards.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be sent to the shards

methods.name: broadcastEval
methods.description: Evaluates a script on all shards, or a given shard, in the context of the {@link Client}s.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on each shard

returns.description: Results of the script execution

methods.name: fetchClientValues
methods.description: Fetches a client property value of each shard, or a given shard.
examples: manager.fetchClientValues('guilds.cache.size')  .then(results => console.log(`${results.reduce((prev, val) => prev + val, 0)} total guilds`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: prop
params.description: Name of the client property to get, using periods for nesting

methods.description: Transforms the resolved received from the API.

methods.name: transformOption
methods.description: Transforms an option received from the API.

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: setDefaultAutoArchiveDuration
methods.description: Sets the default auto archive duration for all newly created threads in this channel.

params.name: defaultAutoArchiveDuration
params.description: The new default auto archive duration

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's default auto archive duration

methods.name: setType
methods.description: Sets the type of this channel (only conversion between text and news is supported)

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's type

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Sets a new topic for the guild channel.
examples: // Set a new channel topicchannel.setTopic('needs more rate limiting')  .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new topic is ${newChannel.topic}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the guild channel's topic

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.
examples: // Create an invite to a channelchannel.createInvite()  .then(invite => console.log(`Created an invite with a code of ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for creating the invite

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

methods.name: setRateLimitPerUser
methods.description: Sets the rate limit per user (slowmode) for this channel.

params.name: rateLimitPerUser
params.description: The new rate limit in seconds

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's rate limit

methods.name: setNSFW
methods.description: Sets whether this channel is flagged as NSFW.

params.name: nsfw
params.description: Whether the channel should be considered NSFW

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's NSFW flag

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a member or role in this channel, taking into account channel overwrites.

params.name: memberOrRole
params.description: The member or role to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether having `ADMINISTRATOR` will return all permissions

methods.name: memberPermissions
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a member in this channel, taking into account channel overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The member to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether having `ADMINISTRATOR` will return all permissions

methods.name: rolePermissions
methods.description: Gets the overall set of permissions for a role in this channel, taking into account channel overwrites.

params.name: role
params.description: The role to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
