methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.
examples: // Create an invite to a channelchannel.createInvite()  .then(invite => console.log(`Created an invite with a code of ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for creating the invite

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Sets the bitrate of the channel.
examples: // Set the bitrate of a voice channelchannel.setBitrate(48_000)  .then(channel => console.log(`Set bitrate to ${channel.bitrate}bps for ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's bitrate

methods.name: setRTCRegion
methods.description: Sets the RTC region of the channel.
examples: // Set the RTC region to sydneychannel.setRTCRegion('sydney');
// Remove a fixed region for this channel - let Discord decide automaticallychannel.setRTCRegion(null, 'We want to let Discord decide.');

params.name: rtcRegion
params.description: The new region of the channel. Set to `null` to remove a specific region for the channel

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason for modifying this region.

methods.name: setUserLimit
methods.description: Sets the user limit of the channel.
examples: // Set the user limit of a voice channelchannel.setUserLimit(42)  .then(channel => console.log(`Set user limit to ${channel.userLimit} for ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the user limit

methods.name: setVideoQualityMode
methods.description: Sets the camera video quality mode of the channel.

params.name: videoQualityMode
params.description: The new camera video quality mode.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the camera video quality mode.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

props.description: The interaction's type

props.description: The interaction's id

props.description: The version

props.description: Set of permissions the application or bot has within the channel the interaction was sent from

props.description: The permissions of the member, if one exists, in the channel this interaction was executed in

props.name: locale
props.description: The locale of the user who invoked this interaction

props.description: The preferred locale from the guild this interaction was sent in

props.description: The timestamp the interaction was created at

props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: deferUpdate
methods.description: Defers an update to the message to which the component was attached.
examples: // Defer updating and reset the component's loading stateinteraction.deferUpdate()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the update to this interaction

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the original message of the component on which the interaction was received on.
examples: // Remove the components from the messageinteraction.update({  content: "A component interaction was received",  components: []})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the updated message

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.description: Indicates whether or not this interaction is both cached and received from a guild.

methods.name: setUsername
methods.description: Sets the username of the logged in client.<info>Changing usernames in Discord is heavily rate limited, with only 2 requestsevery hour. Use this sparingly!</info>
examples: // Set usernameclient.user.setUsername('discordjs', 'passw@rd')  .then(user => console.log(`My new username is ${user.username}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Sets the avatar of the logged in client.
examples: // Set avatarclient.user.setAvatar('./avatar.png')  .then(user => console.log(`New avatar set!`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setPresence
methods.description: Sets the full presence of the client user.
examples: // Set the client user's presenceclient.user.setPresence({ activities: [{ name: 'with discord.js' }], status: 'idle' });

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Sets the status of the client user.
examples: // Set the client user's statusclient.user.setStatus('idle');

methods.description: Sets the activity the client user is playing.
examples: // Set the client user's activityclient.user.setActivity('discord.js', { type: 'WATCHING' });

params.name: name
params.description: Activity being played, or options for setting the activity

examples: // Set HyperSquad HOUSE_BRAVERYclient.user.setHypeSquad(1); || client.user.setHypeSquad('HOUSE_BRAVERY');// Leaveclient.user.setHypeSquad(0);

classes.name: CommandInteraction
classes.description: Represents a command interaction.

props.name: options
props.description: The options passed to the command.

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the channel this interaction was sent in

props.name: commandId
props.description: The invoked application command's id

props.description: The invoked application command's name

props.name: deferred
props.description: Whether the reply to this interaction has been deferred

props.description: Whether this interaction has already been replied to

props.name: ephemeral
props.description: Whether the reply to this interaction is ephemeral

props.name: webhook
props.description: An associated interaction webhook, can be used to further interact with this interaction

props.name: command
props.description: The invoked application command, if it was fetched before

props.name: type
props.description: The interaction's type

props.name: id
props.description: The interaction's id

props.name: token
props.description: The interaction's token

props.name: applicationId
props.description: The application's id

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild this interaction was sent in

props.name: user
props.description: The user which sent this interaction

props.name: member
props.description: If this interaction was sent in a guild, the member which sent it

props.name: version
props.description: The version

props.name: appPermissions
props.description: Set of permissions the application or bot has within the channel the interaction was sent from

props.name: memberPermissions
props.description: The permissions of the member, if one exists, in the channel this interaction was executed in

props.name: locale
props.description: The locale of the user who invoked this interaction

props.name: guildLocale
props.description: The preferred locale from the guild this interaction was sent in

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the interaction was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the interaction was created at

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel this interaction was sent in

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild this interaction was sent in

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the command interaction.This can then be copied by a user and executed again in a new command while keeping the option order.

methods.name: transformResolved
methods.description: Transforms the resolved received from the API.

methods.name: transformOption
methods.description: Transforms an option received from the API.

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: inGuild
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is received from a guild.

methods.name: inCachedGuild
methods.description: Indicates whether or not this interaction is both cached and received from a guild.

methods.name: inRawGuild
methods.description: Indicates whether or not this interaction is received from an uncached guild.

methods.name: isApplicationCommand
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link BaseCommandInteraction}.

methods.name: isCommand
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link CommandInteraction}.

methods.name: isContextMenu
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link ContextMenuInteraction}

methods.name: isModalSubmit
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link ModalSubmitInteraction}

methods.name: isUserContextMenu
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link UserContextMenuInteraction}

methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link MessageContextMenuInteraction}

methods.name: isAutocomplete
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is an {@link AutocompleteInteraction}

methods.name: isMessageComponent
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link MessageComponentInteraction}.

methods.name: isButton
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link ButtonInteraction}.

methods.name: isSelectMenu
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link SelectMenuInteraction}.

methods.name: isRepliable
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction can be replied to.

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.description: Sync VoiceState of this DMChannel.

methods.name: ring
methods.description: Ring the user's phone / PC (call)

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.description: Deletes this channel.
examples: // Delete the channelchannel.delete()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is a {@link DirectoryChannel}

methods.name: fetchIntegrations
methods.description: Fetches a collection of integrations to this guild.Resolves with a collection mapping integrations by their ids.
examples: // Fetch integrationsguild.fetchIntegrations()  .then(integrations => console.log(`Fetched ${integrations.size} integrations`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.description: Fetches a collection of templates from this guild.Resolves with a collection mapping templates by their codes.

methods.description: Fetches the welcome screen for this guild.

methods.description: Creates a template for the guild.

methods.name: fetchPreview
methods.description: Obtains a guild preview for this guild from Discord.

methods.name: fetchVanityData
methods.description: Fetches the vanity URL invite object to this guild.Resolves with an object containing the vanity URL invite code and the use count
examples: // Fetch invite dataguild.fetchVanityData()  .then(res => {    console.log(`Vanity URL: https://discord.gg/${res.code} with ${res.uses} uses`);  })  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the guild.
examples: // Fetch webhooksguild.fetchWebhooks()  .then(webhooks => console.log(`Fetched ${webhooks.size} webhooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchWidget
methods.description: Fetches the guild widget data, requires the widget to be enabled.
examples: // Fetches the guild widget dataguild.fetchWidget()  .then(widget => console.log(`The widget shows ${widget.channels.size} channels`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchWidgetSettings
methods.description: Fetches the guild widget settings.
examples: // Fetches the guild widget settingsguild.fetchWidgetSettings()  .then(widget => console.log(`The widget is ${widget.enabled ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchAuditLogs
methods.description: Fetches audit logs for this guild.
examples: // Output audit log entriesguild.fetchAuditLogs()  .then(audit => console.log(audit.entries.first()))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the guild with new information - e.g. a new name.
examples: // Set the guild nameguild.edit({  name: 'Discord Guild',})  .then(updated => console.log(`New guild name ${updated}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the guild with

methods.description: Whether this guild equals another guild. It compares all properties, so for most operationsit is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is oftenwhat most users need.

methods.description: Marks the guild as read.

examples: // Set invite codeguild.setVanityCode('elysia', '123456')  .then(res => {    console.log(`Vanity URL: https://discord.gg/${res.code} with ${res.uses} uses`);  })  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: mute
methods.description: Mute this guild
examples: // Mute the guild with default settingsguild.mute();
// Mute the guild with custom optionsguild.mute({  muted: true,  suppressRoles: false,  suppressEveryone: true,  muteScheduledEvents: false});

returns.description: The updated guild settings

examples: // Unmute the guildguild.unmute();

returns.description: The updated guild settings

methods.description: Mark all channels in this guild as read
examples: // Mark all channels as readguild.markRead();// Mark specific channels as readguild.markRead([  { channel_id: '123456789012345678', message_id: '987654321098765432' }]);

params.name: readStates
params.description: Array of read states to mark as read

returns.description: The response from Discord

methods.name: search
methods.description: Search for messages in this guild
examples: // Search for messages in a specific channelguild.search({ channelId: '123456789012345678' });// Search for messages by author in a channelguild.search({   channelId: '123456789012345678',  authorId: '987654321098765432' });// Search for messages with images across the guildguild.search({ has: ['image'] });

returns.description: The search results

props.name: communicationDisabledUntilTimestamp

props.name: _roles

props.description: The guild member's banner hash.

props.description: The flags of this member

props.name: partial
props.description: Whether this GuildMember is a partial

props.description: A manager for the roles belonging to this member

props.name: voice
props.description: The voice state of this member

props.description: The time this member joined the guild

props.description: The time this member's timeout will be removed

props.description: The last time this member started boosting the guild

props.description: The presence of this guild member

props.description: The displayed color of this member in base 10

props.name: displayHexColor
props.description: The displayed color of this member in hexadecimal

props.name: id
props.description: The member's id

props.name: displayName
props.description: The nickname of this member, or their user display name if they don't have one

props.name: permissions
props.description: The overall set of permissions for this member, taking only roles and owner status into account

props.name: manageable
props.description: Whether the client user is above this user in the hierarchy, according to role position and guild ownership.This is a prerequisite for many moderative actions.

props.name: kickable
props.description: Whether this member is kickable by the client user

props.name: bannable
props.description: Whether this member is bannable by the client user

props.name: moderatable
props.description: Whether this member is moderatable by the client user

props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: avatarDecorationURL
methods.description: A link to the user's avatar decoration.

methods.name: avatarURL
methods.description: A link to the member's guild avatar.

methods.name: bannerURL
methods.description: A link to the member's banner.

methods.name: displayAvatarDecorationURL
methods.description: A link to the member's guild avatar decoration if they have one.Otherwise, a link to their {@link User#avatarDecorationURL} will be returned.

methods.name: displayAvatarURL
methods.description: A link to the member's guild avatar if they have one.Otherwise, a link to their {@link User#displayAvatarURL} will be returned.

methods.name: displayBannerURL
methods.description: A link to the member's guild banner if they have one.Otherwise, a link to their {@link User#bannerURL} will be returned.

methods.name: isCommunicationDisabled
methods.description: Whether this member is currently timed out

methods.name: permissionsIn
methods.description: Returns `channel.permissionsFor(guildMember)`. Returns permissions for a member in a guild channel,taking into account roles and permission overwrites.

params.name: channel
params.description: The guild channel to use as context

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this member.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to edit the member with

methods.name: setNickname
methods.description: Sets the nickname for this member.
examples: // Set a nickname for a guild memberguildMember.setNickname('cool nickname', 'Needed a new nickname')  .then(member => console.log(`Set nickname of ${member.user.username}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Remove a nickname for a guild memberguildMember.setNickname(null, 'No nicknames allowed!')  .then(member => console.log(`Removed nickname for ${member.user.username}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: nick
params.description: The nickname for the guild member, or `null` if you want to reset their nickname

methods.name: setFlags
methods.description: Sets the flags for this member.

methods.name: createDM
methods.description: Creates a DM channel between the client and this member.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes any DMs with this member.

methods.name: kick
methods.description: Kicks this member from the guild.

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans this guild member.
examples: // Ban a guild member, deleting a week's worth of messagesguildMember.ban({ deleteMessageSeconds: 60 * 60 * 24 * 7, reason: 'They deserved it' })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: disableCommunicationUntil
methods.description: Times this guild member out.
examples: // Time a guild member out for 5 minutesguildMember.disableCommunicationUntil(Date.now() + (5 * 60 * 1000), 'They deserved it')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Remove the timeout of a guild memberguildMember.disableCommunicationUntil(null)  .then(member => console.log(`Removed timeout for ${member.displayName}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: communicationDisabledUntil
params.description: The date or timestampfor the member's communication to be disabled until. Provide `null` to remove the timeout.

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: Times this guild member out.
examples: // Time a guild member out for 5 minutesguildMember.timeout(5 * 60 * 1000, 'They deserved it')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: timeout
params.description: The time in millisecondsfor the member's communication to be disabled until. Provide `null` to remove the timeout.

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches this GuildMember.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Whether this guild member equals another guild member. It compares all properties, so for mostcomparison it is advisable to just compare `member.id === member2.id` as it is significantly fasterand is often what most users need.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the user's mention instead of the GuildMember object.
examples: // Logs: Hello from <@123456789012345678>!console.log(`Hello from ${member}!`);

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Sets the guild avatar of the logged in client.

methods.name: setBanner
methods.description: Sets the guild banner of the logged in client.

methods.name: setAboutMe
methods.description: Set Guild About me

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this user.
examples: // Send a direct messageguildMember.send('Hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content} to ${guildMember.displayName}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the application's name instead of theApplication object.
examples: // Logs: Application name: My Appconsole.log(`Application name: ${application}`);

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this application
examples: // Edit the applicationapplication.edit({  name: 'My New Bot Name',  description: 'A cool bot description',  tags: ['utility', 'moderation']})  .then(app => console.log(`Updated: ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The data to edit the application with

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Sets the avatar of this application
examples: // Set application avatarapplication.setAvatar('./avatar.png')  .then(app => console.log(`Updated avatar for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets the name of this application
examples: // Set application nameapplication.setName('My Cool Bot')  .then(app => console.log(`Renamed to ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Sets the description of this application
examples: // Set application descriptionapplication.setDescription('A helpful utility bot')  .then(app => console.log(`Updated description for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setTags
methods.description: Sets the tags of this application (max 5 tags)
examples: // Set application tagsapplication.setTags(['utility', 'moderation', 'fun'])  .then(app => console.log(`Updated tags for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: addTag
methods.description: Adds a tag to this application
examples: // Add a tag to applicationapplication.addTag('music')  .then(app => console.log(`Added tag to ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: delTag
methods.description: Removes a tag from this application
examples: // Remove a tag from applicationapplication.delTag('music')  .then(app => console.log(`Removed tag from ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: enableIntents
methods.description: Enables intents for this bot application
examples: // Enable intents for botapplication.enableIntents()  .then(app => console.log(`Enabled intents for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: disableIntents
methods.description: Disables intents for this bot application
examples: // Disable intents for botapplication.disableIntents()  .then(app => console.log(`Disabled intents for ${app.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

classes.name: InteractionCollector
classes.description: Collects interactions.Will automatically stop if the message ({@link Client#event:messageDelete messageDelete} or{@link Client#event:messageDeleteBulk messageDeleteBulk}),channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}), orguild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.<info>Interaction collectors that do not specify `time` or `idle` may be prone to always running.Ensure your interaction collectors end via either of these options or manual cancellation.</info>

params.name: client
params.description: The client on which to collect interactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: messageId
props.description: The message from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: channelId
props.description: The channel from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: guildId
props.description: The guild from which to collect interactions, if provided

props.name: interactionType
props.description: The type of interaction to collect

props.name: componentType
props.description: The type of component to collect

props.name: users
props.description: The users that have interacted with this collector

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of interactions collected

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description: Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming interaction for possible collection.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles an interaction for possible disposal.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that could be disposed of

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this interaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

methods.name: _handleThreadDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the thread has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'threadDelete'.

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever an interaction is collected.

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted whenever an interaction is disposed of.

params.name: interaction
params.description: The interaction that was disposed of

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

classes.name: InteractionWebhook

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the interaction webhook

props.name: id
props.description: The webhook's id

props.name: url

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message with this webhook.

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Gets a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: message
params.description: The id of the message to fetch

params.name: cacheOrOptions
params.description: The options to provide to fetch the message.<warn>A **deprecated** boolean may be passed instead to specify whether to cache the message.</warn>

returns.description: Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: editMessage
methods.description: Edits a message that was sent by this webhook.

returns.description: Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: deleteMessage
methods.description: Delete a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: threadId
params.description: The id of the thread this message belongs to

methods.name: createReactionCollector
methods.description: Creates a reaction collector.
examples: // Create a reaction collectorconst filter = (reaction, user) => reaction.emoji.name === '' && user.id === 'someId';const collector = message.createReactionCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', r => console.log(`Collected ${r.emoji.name}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: Options to send to the collector

methods.name: awaitReactions
methods.description: Similar to createReactionCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of reactions that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Create a reaction collectorconst filter = (reaction, user) => reaction.emoji.name === '' && user.id === 'someId'message.awaitReactions({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} reactions`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchReference
methods.description: Fetches the Message this crosspost/reply/pin-add references, if available to the client

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the content of the message.
examples: // Update the content of a messagemessage.edit('This is my new content!')  .then(msg => console.log(`Updated the content of a message to ${msg.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: crosspost
methods.description: Publishes a message in an announcement channel to all channels following it.
examples: // Crosspost a messageif (message.channel.type === 'GUILD_NEWS') {  message.crosspost()    .then(() => console.log('Crossposted message'))    .catch(console.error);}

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages.
examples: // Pin a messagemessage.pin()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages.
examples: // Unpin a messagemessage.unpin()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

methods.name: react
methods.description: Adds a reaction to the message.
examples: // React to a message with a unicode emojimessage.react('')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// React to a message with a custom emojimessage.react(message.guild.emojis.cache.get('123456789012345678'))  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message.
examples: // Delete a messagemessage.delete()  .then(msg => console.log(`Deleted message from ${msg.author.username}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Send an inline reply to this message.
examples: // Reply to a messagemessage.reply('This is a reply!')  .then(() => console.log(`Replied to message "${message.content}"`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: forward
methods.description: Forwards this message

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to forward this message to.

methods.name: startThread
methods.description: Create a new public thread from this message

params.name: options
params.description: Options for starting a thread on this message

methods.name: vote
methods.description: Submits a poll vote for the current user. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
examples: // Vote multi choicesmessage.vote(1,2);// Remove votemessage.vote();

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetch this message.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetches the webhook used to create this message.

methods.name: suppressEmbeds
methods.description: Suppresses or unsuppresses embeds on a message.

params.name: suppress
params.description: If the embeds should be suppressed or not

methods.name: removeAttachments
methods.description: Removes the attachments from this message.

methods.name: resolveComponent
methods.description: Resolves a component by a custom id.

params.name: customId
params.description: The custom id to resolve against

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messageswithout checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. Thismethod allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: inGuild
methods.description: Whether this message is from a guild.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the message's content instead of the object.
examples: // Logs: Message: This is a message!console.log(`Message: ${message}`);

methods.name: clickButton
methods.description: Click a specified button in the message based on the button's CustomID

params.name: buttonid
params.description: customId of the button to clickTo be compatible with Components V2, the following methods have been removed in this version:- Clicking by coordinates (using ActionRow)- Clicking the first button in the messageCurrently, only clicking by CustomID is supported.

methods.name: selectMenu
methods.description: Select specific menu

methods.name: markUnread
methods.description: Marks the message as unread.

methods.name: markRead
methods.description: Marks the message as read.

methods.name: report
methods.description: Report Message
examples: // GET https://discord.com/api/v9/reporting/menu/message?variant=4// Report Category// - <hidden>MESSAGE_WELCOME (3)</hidden>// - Something else (28)// - Hacks, cheats, phishing or malicious links (72)message.report([3, 28, 72]).then(console.log);// { "report_id": "1199663489988440124" }

classes.name: MessageCollector
classes.description: Collects messages on a channel.Will automatically stop if the channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}),thread ({@link Client#event:threadDelete threadDelete}), orguild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to be applied to this collector

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel

props.name: received
props.description: Total number of messages that were received in the channel during message collection

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description: Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles a message for possible collection.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that could be collected

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a message for possible disposal.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that could be disposed of

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

methods.name: _handleThreadDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the thread has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'threadDelete'.

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is collected.

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is disposed of.

params.name: message
params.description: The message that was disposed of

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: deferUpdate
methods.description: Defers an update to the message to which the component was attached.
examples: // Defer updating and reset the component's loading stateinteraction.deferUpdate()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the update to this interaction

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the original message of the component on which the interaction was received on.
examples: // Remove the components from the messageinteraction.update({  content: "A component interaction was received",  components: []})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the updated message

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

classes.name: MessageMentions
classes.description: Keeps track of mentions in a {@link Message}.

props.name: everyone
props.description: Whether `@everyone` or `@here` were mentioned

props.name: users
props.description: Any users that were mentioned<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: roles
props.description: Any roles that were mentioned<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: _members
props.description: Cached members for {@link MessageMentions#members}

props.name: _channels
props.description: Cached channels for {@link MessageMentions#channels}

props.name: _parsedUsers
props.description: Cached users for {@link MessageMentions#parsedUsers}

props.name: crosspostedChannels
props.description: A collection of crossposted channels<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: repliedUser
props.description: The author of the message that this message is a reply to

props.name: members
props.description: Any members that were mentioned (only in {@link Guild}s)<info>Order as received from the API, not as they appear in the message content</info>

props.name: channels
props.description: Any channels that were mentioned<info>Order as they appear first in the message content</info>

props.name: parsedUsers
props.description: Any user mentions that were included in the message content<info>Order as they appear first in the message content</info>

props.name: EVERYONE_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches `@everyone` and `@here`

props.name: USERS_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches user mentions like `<@81440962496172032>`

props.name: ROLES_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches role mentions like `<@&297577916114403338>`

props.name: CHANNELS_PATTERN
props.description: Regular expression that globally matches channel mentions like `<#222079895583457280>`

methods.name: has
methods.description: Checks if a user, guild member, thread member, role, or channel is mentioned.Takes into account user mentions, role mentions, channel mentions,replied user mention, and `@everyone`/`@here` mentions.

methods.name: isFromMessage
methods.description: Whether this is from a {@link MessageComponentInteraction}.

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: deferUpdate
methods.description: Defers an update to the message to which the component was attached.
examples: // Defer updating and reset the component's loading stateinteraction.deferUpdate()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the update to this interaction

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the original message of the component on which the interaction was received on.
examples: // Remove the components from the messageinteraction.update({  content: "A component interaction was received",  components: []})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the updated message

examples: if (channel.type === 'GUILD_NEWS') {  channel.addFollower('222197033908436994', 'Important announcements')    .then(() => console.log('Added follower'))    .catch(console.error);}

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel where the webhook should be created

methods.name: setDefaultAutoArchiveDuration
methods.description: Sets the default auto archive duration for all newly created threads in this channel.

params.name: defaultAutoArchiveDuration
params.description: The new default auto archive duration

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's default auto archive duration

methods.name: setType
methods.description: Sets the type of this channel (only conversion between text and news is supported)

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's type

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Sets a new topic for the guild channel.
examples: // Set a new channel topicchannel.setTopic('needs more rate limiting')  .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new topic is ${newChannel.topic}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the guild channel's topic

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.
examples: // Create an invite to a channelchannel.createInvite()  .then(invite => console.log(`Created an invite with a code of ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for creating the invite

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

classes.name: ReactionCollector
classes.description: Collects reactions on messages.Will automatically stop if the message ({@link Client#event:messageDelete messageDelete} or{@link Client#event:messageDeleteBulk messageDeleteBulk}),channel ({@link Client#event:channelDelete channelDelete}),thread ({@link Client#event:threadDelete threadDelete}), orguild ({@link Client#event:guildDelete guildDelete}) is deleted.

params.name: message
params.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: message
props.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

props.name: users
props.description: The users that have reacted to this message

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of reactions collected

props.name: endReason
props.description: The reason this collector has ended with, or null if it hasn't ended yet

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description: Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming reaction for possible collection.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a reaction deletion for possible disposal.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction to possibly dispose of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this reaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

methods.name: _handleThreadDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the thread has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'threadDelete'.

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

returns.description: Whether the collector ended or not

methods.name: key
methods.description: Gets the collector key for a reaction.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The message reaction to get the key for

events.name: create
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is newly created on a message. Will emit only when a new reaction isadded to the message, as opposed to {@link Collector#collect} which willbe emitted even when a reaction has already been added to the message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is collected.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had all the users removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was disposed of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had one user removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

classes.name: ReactionEmoji
classes.description: Represents a limited emoji set used for both custom and unicode emojis. Custom emojiswill use this class opposed to the Emoji class when the client doesn't know enoughinformation about them.

props.name: reaction
props.description: The message reaction this emoji refers to

props.name: animated
props.description: Whether or not the emoji is animated

props.name: name
props.description: The emoji's name

props.name: id
props.description: The emoji's id

props.name: deleted
props.description: Whether or not the structure has been deleted
props.deprecated: This will be removed in the next major version, see https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/issues/7091

props.name: identifier
props.description: The identifier of this emoji, used for message reactions

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to the emoji file if it's a custom emoji

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the text required to form a graphical emoji on Discordinstead of the Emoji object.
examples: // Send a custom emoji from a guild:const emoji = guild.emojis.cache.first();msg.channel.send(`Hello! ${emoji}`);
// Send the emoji used in a reaction to the channel the reaction is part ofreaction.message.channel.send(`The emoji used was: ${reaction.emoji}`);

classes.name: Role
classes.description: Represents a role on Discord.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild that the role belongs to

props.name: icon
props.description: The icon hash of the role

props.name: unicodeEmoji
props.description: The unicode emoji for the role

props.name: id
props.description: The role's id (unique to the guild it is part of)

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the role

props.name: color
props.description: The base 10 color of the role
props.deprecated: Use {@link Role#colors} instead.

props.name: colors
props.description: The colors of the role

props.name: hoist
props.description: If true, users that are part of this role will appear in a separate category in the users list

props.name: rawPosition
props.description: The raw position of the role from the API

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions of the role

props.name: managed
props.description: Whether or not the role is managed by an external service

props.name: mentionable
props.description: Whether or not the role can be mentioned by anyone

props.name: tags
props.description: The tags this role has

props.name: botId
props.description: The id of the bot this role belongs to

props.name: integrationId
props.description: The id of the integration this role belongs to

props.name: premiumSubscriberRole
props.description: Whether this is the guild's premium subscription role

props.name: subscriptionListingId
props.description: The id of this role's subscription SKU and listing

props.name: availableForPurchase
props.description: Whether this role is available for purchase

props.name: guildConnections
props.description: Whether this role is a guild's linked role

props.name: flags
props.description: The flags of this role

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the role was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the role was created at

props.name: deleted
props.description: Whether or not the role has been deleted
props.deprecated: This will be removed in the next major version, see https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/issues/7091

props.name: hexColor
props.description: The hexadecimal version of the role color, with a leading hashtag

props.name: members
props.description: The cached guild members that have this role

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether the role is editable by the client user

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the role in the role manager

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: comparePositionTo
methods.description: Compares this role's position to another role's.
examples: // Compare the position of a role to anotherconst roleCompare = role.comparePositionTo(otherRole);if (roleCompare >= 1) console.log(`${role.name} is higher than ${otherRole.name}`);

params.name: role
params.description: Role to compare to this one

returns.description: Negative number if this role's position is lower (other role's is higher),positive number if this one is higher (other's is lower), 0 if equal

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the role.
examples: // Edit a rolerole.edit({ name: 'new role' })  .then(updated => console.log(`Edited role name to ${updated.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The new data for the role

methods.name: permissionsIn
methods.description: Returns `channel.permissionsFor(role)`. Returns permissions for a role in a guild channel,taking into account permission overwrites.

params.name: channel
params.description: The guild channel to use as context

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether having `ADMINISTRATOR` will return all permissions

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets a new name for the role.
examples: // Set the name of the rolerole.setName('new role')  .then(updated => console.log(`Updated role name to ${updated.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the role

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the role's name

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Sets a new color for the role.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the role's color

methods.name: setColors
methods.description: Sets new colors for the role.
examples: // Set the colors of a rolerole.setColors({ primaryColor: '#FF0000', secondaryColor: '#00FF00', tertiaryColor: '#0000FF' })  .then(updated => console.log(`Set colors of role to ${updated.colors}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Set holographic colors using constantsrole.setColors({  primaryColor: Constants.HolographicStyle.Primary,  secondaryColor: Constants.HolographicStyle.Secondary,  tertiaryColor: Constants.HolographicStyle.Tertiary,})  .then(updated => console.log(`Set holographic colors for role ${updated.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the role's colors

methods.name: setHoist
methods.description: Sets whether or not the role should be hoisted.
examples: // Set the hoist of the rolerole.setHoist(true)  .then(updated => console.log(`Role hoisted: ${updated.hoist}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: hoist
params.description: Whether or not to hoist the role

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for setting whether or not the role should be hoisted

methods.name: setPermissions
methods.description: Sets the permissions of the role.
examples: // Set the permissions of the rolerole.setPermissions([Permissions.FLAGS.KICK_MEMBERS, Permissions.FLAGS.BAN_MEMBERS])  .then(updated => console.log(`Updated permissions to ${updated.permissions.bitfield}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Remove all permissions from a rolerole.setPermissions(0n)  .then(updated => console.log(`Updated permissions to ${updated.permissions.bitfield}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the role's permissions

methods.name: setMentionable
methods.description: Sets whether this role is mentionable.
examples: // Make the role mentionablerole.setMentionable(true)  .then(updated => console.log(`Role updated ${updated.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: mentionable
params.description: Whether this role should be mentionable

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for setting whether or not this role should be mentionable

methods.name: setIcon
methods.description: Sets a new icon for the role.

params.name: icon
params.description: The icon for the role<warn>The `EmojiResolvable` should belong to the same guild as the role.If not, pass the emoji's URL directly</warn>

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the role's icon

methods.name: setUnicodeEmoji
methods.description: Sets a new unicode emoji for the role.
examples: // Set a new unicode emoji for the rolerole.setUnicodeEmoji('')  .then(updated => console.log(`Set unicode emoji for the role to ${updated.unicodeEmoji}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: unicodeEmoji
params.description: The new unicode emoji for the role

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the role's unicode emoji

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Sets the new position of the role.
examples: // Set the position of the rolerole.setPosition(1)  .then(updated => console.log(`Role position: ${updated.position}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the role

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the role.
examples: // Delete a rolerole.delete('The role needed to go')  .then(deleted => console.log(`Deleted role ${deleted.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchMemberIds
methods.description: Fetches the member ids for this role in the guild.<info>This only returns 100 member ids</info>

methods.name: iconURL
methods.description: A link to the role's icon

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Whether this role equals another role. It compares all properties, so for most operationsit is advisable to just compare `role.id === role2.id` as it is much faster and is oftenwhat most users need.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the role's mention instead of the Role object.
examples: // Logs: Role: <@&123456789012345678>console.log(`Role: ${role}`);

methods.name: comparePositions
methods.description: Compares the positions of two roles.

returns.description: Negative number if the first role's position is lower (second role's is higher),positive number if the first's is higher (second's is lower), 0 if equal

props.name: components
props.description: One to three text components

props.name: accessory
props.description: A thumbnail or a button component, with a future possibility of adding more compatible components

classes.name: SelectMenuInteraction
classes.description: Represents a select menu interaction.
