props.description: The values selected, if the component which was interacted with was a select menu

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the channel this interaction was sent in

props.name: message
props.description: The message to which the component was attached

props.name: customId
props.description: The custom id of the component which was interacted with

props.name: componentType
props.description: The type of component which was interacted with

props.name: deferred
props.description: Whether the reply to this interaction has been deferred

props.name: ephemeral
props.description: Whether the reply to this interaction is ephemeral

props.name: replied
props.description: Whether this interaction has already been replied to

props.name: webhook
props.description: An associated interaction webhook, can be used to further interact with this interaction

props.name: component
props.description: The component which was interacted with

props.name: type
props.description: The interaction's type

props.name: id
props.description: The interaction's id

props.name: token
props.description: The interaction's token

props.name: applicationId
props.description: The application's id

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild this interaction was sent in

props.name: user
props.description: The user which sent this interaction

props.name: member
props.description: If this interaction was sent in a guild, the member which sent it

props.name: version
props.description: The version

props.name: appPermissions
props.description: Set of permissions the application or bot has within the channel the interaction was sent from

props.name: memberPermissions
props.description: The permissions of the member, if one exists, in the channel this interaction was executed in

props.name: locale
props.description: The locale of the user who invoked this interaction

props.name: guildLocale
props.description: The preferred locale from the guild this interaction was sent in

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the interaction was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the interaction was created at

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel this interaction was sent in

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild this interaction was sent in

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: deferUpdate
methods.description: Defers an update to the message to which the component was attached.
examples: // Defer updating and reset the component's loading stateinteraction.deferUpdate()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the update to this interaction

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the original message of the component on which the interaction was received on.
examples: // Remove the components from the messageinteraction.update({  content: "A component interaction was received",  components: []})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the updated message

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: inGuild
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is received from a guild.

methods.name: inCachedGuild
methods.description: Indicates whether or not this interaction is both cached and received from a guild.

methods.name: inRawGuild
methods.description: Indicates whether or not this interaction is received from an uncached guild.

methods.name: isAutocomplete

methods.name: isMessageComponent
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link MessageComponentInteraction}.

methods.name: isButton

methods.name: isSelectMenu
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction is a {@link SelectMenuInteraction}.

methods.name: isRepliable
methods.description: Indicates whether this interaction can be replied to.

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Sets a new topic for the guild channel.
examples: // Set a new channel topicchannel.setTopic('needs more rate limiting')  .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new topic is ${newChannel.topic}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the guild channel's topic

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.
examples: // Create an invite to a channelchannel.createInvite()  .then(invite => console.log(`Created an invite with a code of ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for creating the invite

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Sets the bitrate of the channel.
examples: // Set the bitrate of a voice channelchannel.setBitrate(48_000)  .then(channel => console.log(`Set bitrate to ${channel.bitrate}bps for ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's bitrate

methods.name: setRTCRegion
methods.description: Sets the RTC region of the channel.
examples: // Set the RTC region to sydneychannel.setRTCRegion('sydney');
// Remove a fixed region for this channel - let Discord decide automaticallychannel.setRTCRegion(null, 'We want to let Discord decide.');

params.name: rtcRegion
params.description: The new region of the channel. Set to `null` to remove a specific region for the channel

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason for modifying this region.

methods.name: setUserLimit
methods.description: Sets the user limit of the channel.
examples: // Set the user limit of a voice channelchannel.setUserLimit(42)  .then(channel => console.log(`Set user limit to ${channel.userLimit} for ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the user limit

methods.name: setVideoQualityMode
methods.description: Sets the camera video quality mode of the channel.

params.name: videoQualityMode
params.description: The new camera video quality mode.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the camera video quality mode.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

params.description: The new default auto archive duration

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's default auto archive duration

methods.name: setType
methods.description: Sets the type of this channel (only conversion between text and news is supported)

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's type

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Sets a new topic for the guild channel.
examples: // Set a new channel topicchannel.setTopic('needs more rate limiting')  .then(newChannel => console.log(`Channel's new topic is ${newChannel.topic}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the guild channel's topic

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.
examples: // Create an invite to a channelchannel.createInvite()  .then(invite => console.log(`Created an invite with a code of ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for creating the invite

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

classes.name: ThreadChannel
classes.description: Represents a thread channel on Discord.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild the thread is in

props.name: ownerId
props.description: The id of the member who created this thread

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild the channel is in

props.name: messages
props.description: A manager of the messages sent to this thread

props.name: members
props.description: A manager of the members that are part of this thread

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the thread

props.name: parentId
props.description: The id of the parent channel of this thread

props.name: locked
props.description: Whether the thread is locked

props.name: invitable
props.description: Whether members without `MANAGE_THREADS` can invite other members without `MANAGE_THREADS`<info>Always `null` in public threads</info>

props.name: archived
props.description: Whether the thread is archived

props.name: autoArchiveDuration
props.description: The amount of time (in minutes) after which the thread will automatically archive in case of no recent activity

props.name: archiveTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp when the thread's archive status was last changed<info>If the thread was never archived or unarchived, this is the timestamp at which the thread wascreated</info>

props.name: lastMessageId
props.description: The last message id sent in this thread, if one was sent

props.name: lastPinTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp when the last pinned message was pinned, if there was one

props.name: rateLimitPerUser
props.description: The rate limit per user (slowmode) for this thread in seconds

props.name: messageCount
props.description: <info>Threads created before July 1, 2022 may have an inaccurate count.If you need an approximate value higher than that, use `ThreadChannel#messages.cache.size`</info>

props.name: memberCount
props.description: The approximate count of users in this thread<info>This stops counting at 50. If you need an approximate value higher than that, use`ThreadChannel#members.cache.size`</info>

props.name: totalMessageSent
props.description: The number of messages ever sent in a thread, similar to {@link ThreadChannel#messageCount} except itwill not decrement whenever a message is deleted

props.name: appliedTags
props.description: The tags applied to this thread

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp when this thread was created. This isn't available for threadscreated before 2022-01-09

props.name: guildMembers
props.description: A collection of associated guild member objects of this thread's members

props.name: archivedAt
props.description: The time at which this thread's archive status was last changed<info>If the thread was never archived or unarchived, this is the time at which the thread was created</info>

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the thread was created at

props.name: parent
props.description: The parent channel of this thread

props.name: joined
props.description: Whether the client user is a member of the thread.

props.name: editable
props.description: Whether the thread is editable by the client user (name, archived, autoArchiveDuration)

props.name: joinable
props.description: Whether the thread is joinable by the client user

props.name: manageable
props.description: Whether the thread is manageable by the client user, for deleting or editing rateLimitPerUser or locked.

props.name: viewable
props.description: Whether the thread is viewable by the client user

props.name: sendable
props.description: Whether the client user can send messages in this thread

props.name: unarchivable
props.description: Whether the thread is unarchivable by the client user

props.name: lastMessage
props.description: The Message object of the last message in the channel, if one was sent

props.name: lastPinAt
props.description: The date when the last pinned message was pinned, if there was one

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel

props.name: id
props.description: The channel's id

props.name: flags
props.description: The flags that are applied to the channel.

methods.name: leave

params.name: memberOrRole
params.description: The member or role to obtain the overall permissions for

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether having `ADMINISTRATOR` will return all permissions

methods.description: Fetches the owner of this thread. If the thread member object isn't needed,use {@link ThreadChannel#ownerId} instead.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for fetching the member

methods.name: fetchStarterMessage
methods.description: Fetches the message that started this thread, if any.<info>The `Promise` will reject if the original message in a forum post is deletedor when the original message in the parent channel is deleted.If you just need the id of that message, use {@link ThreadChannel#id} instead.</info>

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this thread.
examples: // Edit a threadthread.edit({ name: 'new-thread' })  .then(editedThread => console.log(editedThread))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: data
params.description: The new data for this thread

methods.name: setArchived
methods.description: Sets whether the thread is archived.
examples: // Archive the threadthread.setArchived(true)  .then(newThread => console.log(`Thread is now ${newThread.archived ? 'archived' : 'active'}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: setAutoArchiveDuration
methods.description: Sets the duration after which the thread will automatically archive in case of no recent activity.
examples: // Set the thread's auto archive time to 1 hourthread.setAutoArchiveDuration(60)  .then(newThread => {    console.log(`Thread will now archive after ${newThread.autoArchiveDuration} minutes of inactivity`);   });  .catch(console.error);

params.name: autoArchiveDuration
params.description: The amount of time (in minutes) after which the threadshould automatically archive in case of no recent activity

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the auto archive duration

methods.name: setInvitable
methods.description: Sets whether members without the `MANAGE_THREADS` permission can invite other members without the`MANAGE_THREADS` permission to this thread.

params.name: invitable
params.description: Whether non-moderators can invite non-moderators to this thread

methods.name: setLocked
methods.description: Sets whether the thread can be **unarchived** by anyone with `SEND_MESSAGES` permission.When a thread is locked only members with `MANAGE_THREADS` can unarchive it.
examples: // Set the thread to lockedthread.setLocked(true)  .then(newThread => console.log(`Thread is now ${newThread.locked ? 'locked' : 'unlocked'}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for locking or unlocking the thread

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets a new name for this thread.
examples: // Change the thread's namethread.setName('not_general')  .then(newThread => console.log(`Thread's new name is ${newThread.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the thread

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the thread's name

methods.description: Sets the rate limit per user (slowmode) for this thread.

params.name: rateLimitPerUser
params.description: The new rate limit in seconds

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the thread's rate limit

methods.description: Pins this thread from the forum channel.

methods.description: Unpins this thread from the forum channel.

methods.description: Set the applied tags for this channel (only applicable to forum threads)

params.name: appliedTags
params.description: The tags to set for this channel

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the thread's applied tags

methods.name: isPrivate
methods.description: Whether this thread is a private thread

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this thread.
examples: // Delete the threadthread.delete('cleaning out old threads')  .then(deletedThread => console.log(deletedThread))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

methods.description: Resolves and transforms options received from the API for a context menu interaction.

methods.description: Transforms the resolved received from the API.

methods.name: transformOption
methods.description: Transforms an option received from the API.

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Creates an invite to this guild channel.
examples: // Create an invite to a channelchannel.createInvite()  .then(invite => console.log(`Created an invite with a code of ${invite.code}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.description: Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

params.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Sets the bitrate of the channel.
examples: // Set the bitrate of a voice channelchannel.setBitrate(48_000)  .then(channel => console.log(`Set bitrate to ${channel.bitrate}bps for ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the channel's bitrate

methods.name: setRTCRegion
methods.description: Sets the RTC region of the channel.
examples: // Set the RTC region to sydneychannel.setRTCRegion('sydney');
// Remove a fixed region for this channel - let Discord decide automaticallychannel.setRTCRegion(null, 'We want to let Discord decide.');

params.name: rtcRegion
params.description: The new region of the channel. Set to `null` to remove a specific region for the channel

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason for modifying this region.

methods.name: setUserLimit
methods.description: Sets the user limit of the channel.
examples: // Set the user limit of a voice channelchannel.setUserLimit(42)  .then(channel => console.log(`Set user limit to ${channel.userLimit} for ${channel.name}`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the user limit

methods.description: Sets the camera video quality mode of the channel.

params.name: videoQualityMode
params.description: The new camera video quality mode.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for changing the camera video quality mode.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites, and id as another channel.In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this channel.
examples: // Delete the channelchannel.delete('making room for new channels')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

examples: // Logs: Hello from <#123456789012345678>!console.log(`Hello from ${channel}!`);

methods.name: isDirectory
methods.description: Indicates whether this channel is a {@link DirectoryChannel}

params.name: mute

methods.name: setDeaf
methods.description: Deafens/undeafens the member of this voice state.

params.name: deaf
params.description: Whether or not the member should be deafened

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the member from the channel.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for disconnecting the member from the channel

methods.name: setChannel
methods.description: Moves the member to a different channel, or disconnects them from the one they're in.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel to move the member to, or `null` if you want todisconnect them from voice.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for moving member to another channel or disconnecting

methods.name: setRequestToSpeak
methods.description: Toggles the request to speak in the channel.Only applicable for stage channels and for the client's own voice state.
examples: // Making the client request to speak in a stage channel (raise its hand)guild.members.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(true);
// Making the client cancel a request to speakguild.members.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(false);

params.name: request
params.description: Whether or not the client is requesting to become a speaker.

methods.name: setSuppressed
methods.description: Suppress/unsuppress the user. Only applicable for stage channels.
examples: // Making the client a speakerguild.members.me.voice.setSuppressed(false);
// Making the client an audience memberguild.members.me.voice.setSuppressed(true);
// Inviting another user to speakvoiceState.setSuppressed(false);
// Moving another user to the audience, or cancelling their invite to speakvoiceState.setSuppressed(true);

params.name: suppressed
params.description: Whether or not the user should be suppressed.

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Sets the status of the voice channel
examples: // Setting the status to somethingguild.members.me.voice.setStatus("something")
// Removing the statusguild.members.me.voice.setStatus()

params.name: status
params.description: The message to set the channel status to

classes.name: Webhook
classes.description: Represents a webhook.

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the webhook

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the webhook

props.name: token
props.description: The token for the webhook, unavailable for follower webhooks and webhooks owned by another application.

props.name: avatar
props.description: The avatar for the webhook

props.name: id
props.description: The webhook's id

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the webhook

props.name: guildId
props.description: The guild the webhook belongs to

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the channel the webhook belongs to

props.name: owner
props.description: The owner of the webhook

props.name: sourceGuild
props.description: The source guild of the webhook

props.name: sourceChannel
props.description: The source channel of the webhook

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel the webhook belongs to

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the webhook was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the webhook was created at

props.name: url
props.description: The URL of this webhook

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message with this webhook.
examples: // Send a basic messagewebhook.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a basic message in a threadwebhook.send({ content: 'hello!', threadId: '836856309672348295' })  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filewebhook.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);
// Send a local filewebhook.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send an embed with a local image insidewebhook.send({  content: 'This is an embed',  embeds: [{    thumbnail: {         url: 'attachment://file.jpg'      }   }],   files: [{      attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',      name: 'file.jpg'   }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: sendSlackMessage
methods.description: Sends a raw slack message with this webhook.
examples: // Send a slack messagewebhook.sendSlackMessage({  'username': 'Wumpus',  'attachments': [{    'pretext': 'this looks pretty cool',    'color': '#F0F',    'footer_icon': 'http://snek.s3.amazonaws.com/topSnek.png',    'footer': 'Powered by sneks',    'ts': Date.now() / 1_000  }]}).catch(console.error);

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits this webhook.

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Gets a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: message
params.description: The id of the message to fetch

params.name: cacheOrOptions
params.description: The options to provide to fetch the message.<warn>A **deprecated** boolean may be passed instead to specify whether to cache the message.</warn>

returns.description: Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: editMessage
methods.description: Edits a message that was sent by this webhook.

returns.description: Returns the raw message data if the webhook was instantiated as a{@link WebhookClient} or if the channel is uncached, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the webhook.

methods.name: deleteMessage
methods.description: Delete a message that was sent by this webhook.

params.name: threadId
params.description: The id of the thread this message belongs to

methods.name: avatarURL
methods.description: A link to the webhook's avatar.

methods.name: isChannelFollower
methods.description: Whether or not this webhook is a channel follower webhook.

methods.name: isIncoming
methods.description: Whether or not this webhook is an incoming webhook.

classes.name: Options
classes.description: Contains various utilities for client options.

props.name: defaultMakeCacheSettings
props.description: The default settings passed to {@link ClientOptions.makeCache}.The caches that this changes are:* `MessageManager` - Limit to 200 messages* `ChannelManager` - Sweep archived threads* `GuildChannelManager` - Sweep archived threads* `ThreadManager` - Sweep archived threads<info>If you want to keep default behavior and add on top of it you can use this object and add on to it, e.g.`makeCache: Options.cacheWithLimits({ ...Options.defaultMakeCacheSettings, ReactionManager: 0 })`</info>

props.name: defaultSweeperSettings
props.description: The default settings passed to {@link ClientOptions.sweepers}.The sweepers that this changes are:* `threads` - Sweep archived threads every hour, removing those archived more than 4 hours ago<info>If you want to keep default behavior and add on top of it you can use this object and add on to it, e.g.`sweepers: { ...Options.defaultSweeperSettings, messages: { interval: 300, lifetime: 600 } }`</info>

methods.name: createDefault
methods.description: The default client options.

methods.name: cacheWithLimits
methods.description: Create a cache factory using predefined settings to sweep or limit.
examples: // Store up to 200 messages per channel and discard archived threads if they were archived more than 4 hours ago.// Note archived threads will remain in the guild and client caches with these settingsOptions.cacheWithLimits({   MessageManager: 200,   ThreadManager: {     sweepInterval: 3600,     sweepFilter: LimitedCollection.filterByLifetime({       getComparisonTimestamp: e => e.archiveTimestamp,       excludeFromSweep: e => !e.archived,     }),   }, });

// Sweep messages every 5 minutes, removing messages that have not been edited or created in the last 30 minutesOptions.cacheWithLimits({  // Keep default thread sweeping behavior  ...Options.defaultMakeCacheSettings,  // Override MessageManager  MessageManager: {    sweepInterval: 300,    sweepFilter: LimitedCollection.filterByLifetime({      lifetime: 1800,      getComparisonTimestamp: e => e.editedTimestamp ?? e.createdTimestamp,    })  }});

params.name: settings
params.description: Settings passed to the relevant constructor.If no setting is provided for a manager, it uses Collection.If a number is provided for a manager, it uses that number as the max size for a LimitedCollection.If LimitedCollectionOptions are provided for a manager, it uses those settings to form a LimitedCollection.

methods.name: cacheEverything
methods.description: Create a cache factory that always caches everything.

classes.name: Permissions
classes.description: Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a permission bitfield. All {@link GuildMember}s have a set ofpermissions in their guild, and each channel in the guild may also have {@link PermissionOverwrites} for the memberthat override their default permissions.

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits

props.name: FLAGS
props.description: Numeric permission flags. All available properties:* `CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE` (create invitations to the guild)* `KICK_MEMBERS`* `BAN_MEMBERS`* `ADMINISTRATOR` (implicitly has *all* permissions, and bypasses all channel overwrites)* `MANAGE_CHANNELS` (edit and reorder channels)* `MANAGE_GUILD` (edit the guild information, region, etc.)* `ADD_REACTIONS` (add new reactions to messages)* `VIEW_AUDIT_LOG`* `PRIORITY_SPEAKER`* `STREAM`* `VIEW_CHANNEL`* `SEND_MESSAGES`* `SEND_TTS_MESSAGES`* `MANAGE_MESSAGES` (delete messages and reactions)* `EMBED_LINKS` (links posted will have a preview embedded)* `ATTACH_FILES`* `READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY` (view messages that were posted prior to opening Discord)* `MENTION_EVERYONE`* `USE_EXTERNAL_EMOJIS` (use emojis from different guilds)* `VIEW_GUILD_INSIGHTS`* `CONNECT` (connect to a voice channel)* `SPEAK` (speak in a voice channel)* `MUTE_MEMBERS` (mute members across all voice channels)* `DEAFEN_MEMBERS` (deafen members across all voice channels)* `MOVE_MEMBERS` (move members between voice channels)* `USE_VAD` (use voice activity detection)* `CHANGE_NICKNAME`* `MANAGE_NICKNAMES` (change other members' nicknames)* `MANAGE_ROLES`* `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS`* `MANAGE_EMOJIS_AND_STICKERS`* `USE_APPLICATION_COMMANDS`* `REQUEST_TO_SPEAK`* `MANAGE_EVENTS`* `MANAGE_THREADS`* `USE_PUBLIC_THREADS` (deprecated)* `CREATE_PUBLIC_THREADS`* `USE_PRIVATE_THREADS` (deprecated)* `CREATE_PRIVATE_THREADS`* `USE_EXTERNAL_STICKERS` (use stickers from different guilds)* `SEND_MESSAGES_IN_THREADS`* `START_EMBEDDED_ACTIVITIES`* `MODERATE_MEMBERS`* `VIEW_CREATOR_MONETIZATION_ANALYTICS`* `USE_SOUNDBOARD`* `CREATE_GUILD_EXPRESSIONS`* `CREATE_EVENTS`* `USE_EXTERNAL_SOUNDS`* `SEND_VOICE_MESSAGES`* `USE_CLYDE_AI`* `SET_VOICE_CHANNEL_STATUS`* `SEND_POLLS`* `USE_EXTERNAL_APPS`

props.name: ALL
props.description: Bitfield representing every permission combined

props.name: DEFAULT
props.description: Bitfield representing the default permissions for users

props.description: Bitfield representing the permissions required for moderators of stage channels

returns.description: Amount of guild members that were removed from the caches

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description: Sweeps all text-based channels' messages and removes the ones which are indicated by the filter.
examples: // Remove all messages older than 1800 seconds from the messages cacheconst amount = sweepers.sweepMessages(  Sweepers.filterByLifetime({    lifetime: 1800,    getComparisonTimestamp: m => m.editedTimestamp ?? m.createdTimestamp,  })(),);console.log(`Successfully removed ${amount} messages from the cache.`);

params.name: filter
params.description: The function used to determine which messages will be removed from the caches.

returns.description: Amount of messages that were removed from the caches

methods.name: sweepPresences
methods.description: Sweeps all presences and removes the ones which are indicated by the filter.

params.description: The function used to determine which presences will be removed from the caches.

returns.description: Amount of presences that were removed from the caches

methods.name: sweepThreads
methods.description: Sweeps all threads and removes the ones which are indicated by the filter.
examples: // Remove all threads archived greater than 1 day ago from all the channel cachesconst amount = sweepers.sweepThreads(  Sweepers.filterByLifetime({    getComparisonTimestamp: t => t.archivedTimestamp,    excludeFromSweep: t => !t.archived,  })(),);console.log(`Successfully removed ${amount} threads from the cache.`);

params.name: filter

returns.description: filter Amount of threads that were removed from the caches

interfaces.name: InteractionResponses
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that support shared interaction response types.

methods.name: deferReply
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples: // Defer the reply to this interactioninteraction.deferReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)
// Defer to send an ephemeral reply laterinteraction.deferReply({ ephemeral: true })  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.<info>Use the `fetchReply` option to get the bot's reply message.</info>
examples: // Reply to the interaction and fetch the responseinteraction.reply({ content: 'Pong!', fetchReply: true })  .then((message) => console.log(`Reply sent with content ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

// Create an ephemeral reply with an embedconst embed = new MessageEmbed().setDescription('Pong!');interaction.reply({ embeds: [embed], ephemeral: true })  .then(() => console.log('Reply sent.'))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Fetch the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.fetchReply()  .then(reply => console.log(`Replied with ${reply.content}`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Edit the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.editReply('New content')  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes a reply to this interaction.
examples: // Delete the initial reply to this interactioninteraction.deleteReply()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: deferUpdate
methods.description: Defers an update to the message to which the component was attached.
examples: // Defer updating and reset the component's loading stateinteraction.deferUpdate()  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the update to this interaction

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the original message of the component on which the interaction was received on.
examples: // Remove the components from the messageinteraction.update({  content: "A component interaction was received",  components: []})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the updated message

methods.name: showModal
methods.description: Shows a modal component

methods.name: awaitModalSubmit
methods.description: Collects a single modal submit interaction that passes the filter.The Promise will reject if the time expires.
examples: // Collect a modal submit interactionconst filter = (interaction) => interaction.customId === 'modal';interaction.awaitModalSubmit({ filter, time: 15_000 })  .then(interaction => console.log(`${interaction.customId} was submitted!`))  .catch(console.error);

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

interfaces.name: TextBasedChannel
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that have text-channel-like features.

props.name: messages
props.description: A manager of the messages sent to this channel

props.name: lastMessageId
props.description: The channel's last message id, if one was sent

props.name: lastPinTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp when the last pinned message was pinned, if there was one

props.name: lastMessage
props.description: The Message object of the last message in the channel, if one was sent

props.name: lastPinAt
props.description: The date when the last pinned message was pinned, if there was one

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.
examples: // Send a basic messagechannel.send('hello!')  .then(message => console.log(`Sent message: ${message.content}`))  .catch(console.error);
// Send a remote filechannel.send({  files: ['https://cdn.discordapp.com/icons/222078108977594368/6e1019b3179d71046e463a75915e7244.png?size=2048']})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

// Send a local filechannel.send({  files: [{    attachment: 'entire/path/to/file.jpg',    name: 'file.jpg',    description: 'A description of the file'  }]})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: search
methods.description: Search for messages in this channel
examples: // Search for messages by authorchannel.search({ authorId: '123456789012345678' });// Search for messages with imageschannel.search({ has: ['image'] });// Search for pinned messageschannel.search({ pinned: true });

returns.description: The search results

methods.name: sendTyping
methods.description: Sends a typing indicator in the channel.
examples: // Start typing in a channelchannel.sendTyping();

returns.description: Resolves upon the typing status being sent

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.
examples: // Create a message collectorconst filter = m => m.content.includes('discord');const collector = channel.createMessageCollector({ filter, time: 15_000 });collector.on('collect', m => console.log(`Collected ${m.content}`));collector.on('end', collected => console.log(`Collected ${collected.size} items`));

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description: Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.
examples: // Await !vote messagesconst filter = m => m.content.startsWith('!vote');// Errors: ['time'] treats ending because of the time limit as an errorchannel.awaitMessages({ filter, max: 4, time: 60_000, errors: ['time'] })  .then(collected => console.log(collected.size))  .catch(collected => console.log(`After a minute, only ${collected.size} out of 4 voted.`));

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetches all webhooks for the channel.
examples: // Fetch webhookschannel.fetchWebhooks()  .then(hooks => console.log(`This channel has ${hooks.size} hooks`))  .catch(console.error);

methods.name: createWebhook
methods.description: Creates a webhook for the channel.
examples: // Create a webhook for the current channelchannel.createWebhook('Snek', {  avatar: 'https://i.imgur.com/mI8XcpG.jpg',  reason: 'Needed a cool new Webhook'})  .then(console.log)  .catch(console.error)

returns.description: Returns the created Webhook

typedefs.name: ReceiveStreamOptions
typedefs.description: Options passed to `VoiceReceiver#createStream`.

props.name: mode
props.description: The mode for audio output. This defaults to opus, meaning discord.js won't decodethe packets for you. You can set this to 'pcm' so that the stream's output will be 16-bit little-endian stereoaudio

props.name: end
props.description: When the stream should be destroyed. If `silence`, this will be when the userstops talking. Otherwise, if `manual`, this should be handled by you.

props.name: paddingSilence
props.description: Whether to add silence paddingIf 'end' is set to 'silence', this property automatically defaults to `false`

props.name: udp4
props.description: IPv4 address

props.name: udp6
props.description: IPv6 address

typedefs.name: StreamOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed to stream-playing methods:

props.name: type
props.description: The type of stream.

props.name: seek
props.description: The time to seek to, will be ignored when playing `ogg/opus` or `webm/opus` streams

props.name: volume
props.description: The volume to play at. Set this to false to disable volume transforms forthis stream to improve performance.

props.name: plp
props.description: Expected packet loss percentage

props.name: fec
props.description: Enabled forward error correction

props.name: bitrate
props.description: The bitrate (quality) of the audio in kbps.If set to 'auto', the voice channel's bitrate will be used

props.name: highWaterMark
props.description: The maximum number of opus packets to make and store before they areactually needed. See https://nodejs.org/en/docs/guides/backpressuring-in-streams/. Setting this value to1 means that changes in volume will be more instant.

typedefs.name: StreamType
typedefs.description: An option passed as part of `StreamOptions` specifying the type of the stream.* `unknown`: The default type, streams/input will be passed through to ffmpeg before encoding.Will play most streams.* `converted`: Play a stream of 16bit signed stereo PCM data, skipping ffmpeg.* `opus`: Play a stream of opus packets, skipping ffmpeg. You lose the ability to alter volume.* `ogg/opus`: Play an ogg file with the opus encoding, skipping ffmpeg. You lose the ability to alter volume.* `webm/opus`: Play a webm file with opus audio, skipping ffmpeg. You lose the ability to alter volume.

props.name: presetH26x

props.name: inputFFmpegArgs
props.description: input ffmpegEx: ['-config1', 'value1', '-config2', 'value2']

props.name: outputFFmpegArgs
props.description: output ffmpegEx: ['-config1', 'value1', '-config2', 'value2']

props.name: bitrate
props.description: The bitrate (quality) of the video in kbps.If set to 'auto', ffmpeg will automatically select

typedefs.name: BaseFetchOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch data from Discord

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether to cache the fetched data if it wasn't already

props.name: force
props.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

typedefs.name: FetchApplicationCommandOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch Application Commands from Discord

props.name: guildId
props.description: The guild's id to fetch commands for, for when the guild is not cached

props.name: locale
props.description: The locale to use when fetching this command

props.name: withLocalizations
props.description: Whether to fetch all localization data

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandPermissionData
typedefs.description: Data for setting the permissions of an application command.

props.name: id
props.description: The role or user's id

props.name: type
props.description: Whether this permission is for a role or a user

props.name: permission
props.description: Whether the role or user has the permission to use this command

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandPermissions
typedefs.description: The object returned when fetching permissions for an application command.

props.name: id
props.description: The role or user's id

props.name: type
props.description: Whether this permission is for a role or a user

props.name: permission
props.description: Whether the role or user has the permission to use this command

typedefs.name: BaseApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description: Options for managing permissions for one or more Application Commands<warn>When passing these options to a manager where `guildId` is `null`,`guild` is a required parameter</warn>

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild to modify / check permissions for<warn>Ignored when the manager has a non-null `guildId` property</warn>

props.name: command
props.description: The command to modify / check permissions for<warn>Ignored when the manager has a non-null `commandId` property</warn>

typedefs.name: GuildApplicationCommandPermissionData
typedefs.description: Data used for overwriting the permissions for all application commands in a guild.

props.name: id
props.description: The command's id

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions for this command

typedefs.name: SetApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to set permissions for one or more Application Commands in a guild<warn>One of `command` AND `permissions`, OR `fullPermissions` is required.`fullPermissions` is not a valid option when passing to a manager where `commandId` is non-null</warn>

props.name: permissions
props.description: The new permissions for the command

props.name: fullPermissions
props.description: The new permissions for all commandsin a guild <warn>When this parameter is set, `permissions` and `command` are ignored</warn>

typedefs.name: AddApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to add permissions to a command<warn>The `command` parameter is not optional when the managers `commandId` is `null`</warn>

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions to add to the command

typedefs.name: RemoveApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to remove permissions from a command<warn>The `command` parameter is not optional when the managers `commandId` is `null`</warn>

props.name: users
props.description: The user(s) to remove from the command permissions<warn>One of `users` or `roles` is required</warn>

props.name: roles
props.description: The role(s) to remove from the command permissions<warn>One of `users` or `roles` is required</warn>

typedefs.name: HasApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to check the existence of permissions on a command<warn>The `command` parameter is not optional when the managers `commandId` is `null`</warn>

props.name: permissionId
props.description: The user or role to check if a permission exists foron this command.

typedefs.name: AutoModerationTriggerMetadataOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to set the trigger metadata of an auto moderation rule.

props.name: keywordFilter
props.description: The substrings that will be searched for in the content

props.name: regexPatterns
props.description: The regular expression patterns which will be matched against the content<info>Only Rust-flavored regular expressions are supported.</info>

props.name: presets
props.description: The internally pre-defined wordsets which will be searched for in the content

props.name: allowList
props.description: The substrings that will be exempt from triggering{@link AutoModerationRuleTriggerType.KEYWORD} and {@link AutoModerationRuleTriggerType.KEYWORD_PRESET}

props.name: mentionTotalLimit
props.description: The total number of role & user mentions allowed per message

props.name: mentionRaidProtectionEnabled
props.description: Whether to automatically detect mention raids

typedefs.name: AutoModerationActionOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to set the actions of an auto moderation rule.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of this auto moderation rule action

props.name: metadata
props.description: Additional metadata needed during execution<info>This property is required if using a `type` of{@link AutoModerationActionType.SEND_ALERT_MESSAGE} or {@link AutoModerationActionType.TIMEOUT}.</info>

typedefs.name: AutoModerationActionMetadataOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to set the metadata of an auto moderation rule action.

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel to which content will be logged

props.name: durationSeconds
props.description: The timeout duration in seconds

props.name: customMessage
props.description: The custom message that is shown whenever a message is blocked

typedefs.name: AutoModerationRuleCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to create an auto moderation rule.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the auto moderation rule

props.name: eventType
props.description: The event type of the auto moderation rule

props.name: triggerType
props.description: The trigger type of the auto moderation rule

props.name: triggerMetadata
props.description: The trigger metadata of the auto moderation rule<info>This property is required if the following `triggerType`s are used:* {@link AutoModerationRuleTriggerType.KEYWORD KEYWORD}* {@link AutoModerationRuleTriggerType.KEYWORD_PRESET KEYWORD_PRESET}* {@link AutoModerationRuleTriggerType.MENTION_SPAM MENTION_SPAM}</info>

props.name: actions
props.description: The actions that will execute when the auto moderation rule is triggered

props.name: enabled
props.description: Whether the auto moderation rule should be enabled

props.name: exemptRoles
props.description: The roles that should not be affected by the auto moderation rule

props.name: exemptChannels
props.description: The channels that should not be affected by the auto moderation rule

props.name: reason
props.description: The reason for creating the auto moderation rule

typedefs.name: AutoModerationRuleEditOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to edit an auto moderation rule.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the auto moderation rule

props.name: eventType
props.description: The event type of the auto moderation rule

props.name: triggerMetadata
props.description: The trigger metadata of the auto moderation rule

props.name: actions
props.description: The actions that will execute when the auto moderation rule is triggered

props.name: enabled
props.description: Whether the auto moderation rule should be enabled

props.name: exemptRoles
props.description: The roles that should not be affected by the auto moderation rule

props.name: exemptChannels
props.description: The channels that should not be affected by the auto moderation rule

props.name: reason
props.description: The reason for creating the auto moderation rule

typedefs.name: AutoModerationRuleResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give an AutoModerationRule object. This can be:* An AutoModerationRule* A Snowflake

typedefs.name: FetchAutoModerationRuleOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch a single auto moderation rule from a guild.

props.name: autoModerationRule
props.description: The auto moderation rule to fetch

typedefs.name: FetchAutoModerationRulesOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch all auto moderation rules from a guild.

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether to cache the fetched auto moderation rules

typedefs.name: EmojiResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved into a GuildEmoji object. This can be:* A Snowflake* A GuildEmoji object* A ReactionEmoji object

typedefs.name: EmojiIdentifierResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give an emoji identifier. This can be:* An EmojiResolvable* The `<a:name:id>`, `<:name:id>`, `a:name:id` or `name:id` emoji identifier string of an emoji* The Unicode representation of an emoji

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Channel object. This can be:* A Channel object* A Snowflake

typedefs.name: FetchChannelOptions
typedefs.description: Options for fetching a channel from Discord

props.name: allowUnknownGuild
props.description: Allows the channel to be returned even if the guild is not in cache,it will not be cached. <warn>Many of the properties and methods on the returned channel will throw errors</warn>

typedefs.name: CustomStatusOption
typedefs.description: CustomStatus Object

props.name: text
props.description: Text to set

props.name: status
props.description: The status to set: 'online', 'idle', 'dnd', 'invisible' or null.

props.name: emoji
props.description: UnicodeEmoji, DiscordEmoji, or null.

props.name: expires
props.description: The number of seconds until the status expires, or null.

typedefs.name: GuildBanResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a GuildBan object. This can be:* A GuildBan object* A User resolvable

typedefs.name: FetchBanOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch a single ban from a guild.

props.name: user
props.description: The ban to fetch

typedefs.name: FetchBansOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch multiple bans from a guild.

props.name: limit
props.description: The maximum number of bans to return

props.name: before
props.description: Consider only bans before this id

props.name: after
props.description: Consider only bans after this id

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether to cache the fetched bans

typedefs.name: BanOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to ban a user from a guild.

props.name: days
props.description: Number of days of messages to delete, must be between 0 and 7, inclusive<warn>This property is deprecated. Use `deleteMessageSeconds` instead.</warn>

props.name: deleteMessageSeconds
props.description: Number of seconds of messages to delete,must be between 0 and 604800 (7 days), inclusive

props.name: reason
props.description: The reason for the ban

typedefs.name: BulkBanOptions
typedefs.description: Options used for bulk banning users from a guild.

props.name: deleteMessageSeconds
props.description: Number of seconds of messages to delete,must be between 0 and 604800 (7 days), inclusive

props.name: reason
props.description: The reason for the bans

typedefs.name: BulkBanResult
typedefs.description: Result of bulk banning users from a guild.

props.name: bannedUsers
props.description: IDs of the banned users

props.name: failedUsers
props.description: IDs of the users that could not be banned or were already banned

typedefs.name: GuildChannelResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Guild Channel object. This can be:* A GuildChannel object* A ThreadChannel object* A Snowflake

typedefs.name: GuildChannelCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to create a new channel in a guild.

props.name: parent
props.description: Parent of the new channel

typedefs.name: ChannelData
typedefs.description: The data for a guild channel.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the channel

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel (only conversion between text and news is supported)

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the channel

props.name: topic
props.description: The topic of the text channel

props.name: nsfw
props.description: Whether the channel is NSFW

props.name: bitrate
props.description: The bitrate of the voice channel

props.name: userLimit
props.description: The user limit of the voice channel

props.name: parent
props.description: The parent of the channel

props.name: lockPermissions
props.description: Lock the permissions of the channel to what the parent's permissions are

props.name: permissionOverwrites
props.description: Permission overwrites for the channel

props.name: rateLimitPerUser
props.description: The rate limit per user (slowmode) for the channel in seconds

props.name: defaultAutoArchiveDuration
props.description: The default auto archive duration for all new threads in this channel

props.name: rtcRegion
props.description: The RTC region of the channel

props.name: videoQualityMode
props.description: The camera video quality mode of the channel

props.name: flags
props.description: The flags to set on the channel

props.name: availableTags
props.description: The tags to set as available in a forum channel

props.name: defaultReactionEmoji
props.description: The emoji to set as the default reaction emoji

props.name: defaultThreadRateLimitPerUser
props.description: The rate limit per user (slowmode) to set on forum posts

props.name: defaultSortOrder
props.description: The default sort order mode to set on the channel

typedefs.name: CategoryChannelResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Category Channel object. This can be:* A CategoryChannel object* A Snowflake

typedefs.name: ChannelPosition
typedefs.description: The data needed for updating a channel's position.

props.name: channel
props.description: Channel to update

props.name: position
props.description: New position for the channel

props.name: parent
props.description: Parent channel for this channel

props.name: lockPermissions
props.description: If the overwrites should be locked to the parents overwrites

typedefs.name: GuildEmojiCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options used for creating an emoji in a guild.

props.name: roles
props.description: The roles to limit the emoji to

props.name: reason
props.description: The reason for creating the emoji

props.name: stickers
props.description: The stickers to send with the message

props.name: flags
props.description: The flags to send with the message.Only `SUPPRESS_EMBEDS` and `SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATIONS` can be set.

typedefs.name: GuildForumThreadCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options for creating a thread.

props.name: message
props.description: The message associated with the thread post

props.name: appliedTags
props.description: The tags to apply to the thread

typedefs.name: InviteResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give an invite code. This can be:* An invite code* An invite URL

typedefs.name: GuildInvitableChannelResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to a channel that an invite can be created on. This can be:* TextChannel* VoiceChannel* NewsChannel* StoreChannel* StageChannel* Snowflake

typedefs.name: FetchInviteOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch a single invite from a guild.

props.name: code
props.description: The invite to fetch

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invite

props.name: force
props.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

typedefs.name: FetchInvitesOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch all invites from a guild.

props.name: channelId
props.description: The channel to fetch all invites from

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched invites

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:* A Guild object* A GuildChannel object* A GuildEmoji object* A Role object* A Snowflake* An Invite object

typedefs.name: PartialRoleData
typedefs.description: Partial data for a Role.

props.name: id

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the role

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the role, either a hex string or a base 10 number

props.name: hoist
props.description: Whether or not the role should be hoisted

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the role

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions of the role

props.name: mentionable
props.description: Whether or not the role should be mentionable

typedefs.description: Partial overwrite data.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of this overwrite

props.name: allow
props.description: The permissions to allow

props.name: deny
props.description: The permissions to deny

typedefs.name: PartialChannelData
typedefs.description: Partial data for a Channel.

props.name: id
props.description: The channel's id, used to set its parent,this is a placeholder and will be replaced by the API after consumption

props.name: parentId
props.description: The parent id for this channel

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the channel

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the channel

props.name: topic
props.description: The topic of the text channel

props.name: nsfw
props.description: Whether the channel is NSFW

props.name: bitrate
props.description: The bitrate of the voice channel

props.name: userLimit
props.description: The user limit of the channel

props.name: rtcRegion
props.description: The RTC region of the channel

props.name: videoQualityMode
props.description: The camera video quality mode of the channel

props.name: permissionOverwrites
props.description: Overwrites of the channel

props.name: rateLimitPerUser
props.description: The rate limit per user (slowmode) of the channel in seconds

typedefs.name: GuildCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to create a guild.

props.name: afkChannelId
props.description: The AFK channel's id

props.name: afkTimeout
props.description: The AFK timeout in seconds

props.name: channels
props.description: The channels for this guild

props.name: defaultMessageNotifications
props.description: The default message notificationsfor the guild

props.name: explicitContentFilter
props.description: The explicit content filter level for the guild

props.name: icon
props.description: The icon for the guild

props.name: roles
props.description: The roles for this guild,the first element of this array is used to change properties of the guild's everyone role.

props.name: systemChannelId
props.description: The system channel's id

props.name: systemChannelFlags
props.description: The flags of the system channel

props.name: verificationLevel
props.description: The verification level for the guild

typedefs.name: FetchGuildOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch a single guild.

props.name: guild
props.description: The guild to fetch

props.name: withCounts
props.description: Whether the approximate member and presence counts should be returned

typedefs.name: FetchGuildsOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch multiple guilds.

props.name: before
props.description: Get guilds before this guild id

props.name: after
props.description: Get guilds after this guild id

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of guilds to request (1-200)

typedefs.name: IncidentActionsEditOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to set incident actions. Supplying `null` to any option will disable the action.

props.name: invitesDisabledUntil
props.description: When invites should be enabled again

props.name: dmsDisabledUntil
props.description: When direct messages should be enabled again

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:* A GuildMember object* A User resolvable

typedefs.name: AddGuildMemberOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to add a user to a guild using OAuth2.

props.name: accessToken
props.description: An OAuth2 access token for the user with the `guilds.join` scope granted to thebot's application

props.name: nick
props.description: The nickname to give to the member (requires `MANAGE_NICKNAMES`)

props.name: roles
props.description: The roles to add to the member(requires `MANAGE_ROLES`)

props.name: mute
props.description: Whether the member should be muted (requires `MUTE_MEMBERS`)

props.name: deaf
props.description: Whether the member should be deafened (requires `DEAFEN_MEMBERS`)

props.name: force
props.description: Whether to skip the cache check and call the API directly

props.name: fetchWhenExisting
props.description: Whether to fetch the user if not cached and already a member

typedefs.name: FetchMemberOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch a single member from a guild.

props.name: user
props.description: The user to fetch

typedefs.name: FetchMembersOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch multiple members from a guild.

props.name: user
props.description: The user(s) to fetch

props.name: query
props.description: Limit fetch to members with similar usernames

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of members to request

props.name: withPresences
props.description: Whether or not to include the presences

props.name: time
props.description: Timeout for receipt of members

props.name: nonce
props.description: Nonce for this request (32 characters max - default to base 16 now timestamp)

props.name: force
props.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

typedefs.name: GuildSearchMembersOptions
typedefs.description: Options used for searching guild members.

props.name: query
props.description: Filter members whose username or nickname start with this query

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of members to search

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether or not to cache the fetched member(s)

typedefs.name: GuildMemberEditData
typedefs.description: The data for editing a guild member.

props.name: nick
props.description: The nickname to set for the member

props.name: roles
props.description: The roles or role ids to apply

props.name: mute
props.description: Whether or not the member should be muted

props.name: deaf
props.description: Whether or not the member should be deafened

props.name: channel
props.description: Channel to move the member to(if they are connected to voice), or `null` if you want to disconnect them from voice

props.name: communicationDisabledUntil
props.description: The date or timestampfor the member's communication to be disabled until. Provide `null` to enable communication again.

props.name: flags
props.description: The flags to set for the member

props.name: avatar
props.description: The new guild avatar

props.name: banner
props.description: The new guild banner

props.name: bio
props.description: The new guild about me

typedefs.name: GuildPruneMembersOptions
typedefs.description: Options used for pruning guild members.<info>It's recommended to set {@link GuildPruneMembersOptions#count options.count}to `false` for large guilds.</info>

props.name: days
props.description: Number of days of inactivity required to kick

props.name: dry
props.description: Get the number of users that will be kicked, without actually kicking them

props.name: count
props.description: Whether or not to return the number of users that have been kicked.

props.name: roles
props.description: Array of roles to bypass the "...and no roles" constraint when pruning

props.name: reason
props.description: Reason for this prune

typedefs.name: GuildScheduledEventResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a GuildScheduledEvent object. This can be:* A Snowflake* A GuildScheduledEvent object
