typedefs.description: Options for setting a recurrence rule for a guild scheduled event.

props.name: startAt
props.description: The time the recurrence rule interval starts at

props.name: frequency
props.description: How often the event occurs

props.name: interval
props.description: The spacing between the events

props.name: byWeekday
props.description: The days within a week to recur on

props.name: byNWeekday
props.description: The days within a week to recur on

props.name: byMonth
props.description: The months to recur on

props.name: byMonthDay
props.description: The days within a month to recur on

typedefs.name: GuildScheduledEventCreateOptions

props.description: The name of the guild scheduled event

props.name: scheduledStartTime
props.description: The time to schedule the event at

props.name: scheduledEndTime
props.description: The time to end the event at<warn>This is required if `entityType` is 'EXTERNAL'</warn>

props.name: privacyLevel
props.description: The privacy level of the guild scheduled event

props.name: entityType
props.description: The scheduled entity type of the event

props.name: description
props.description: The description of the guild scheduled event

props.name: channel
props.description: The channel of the guild scheduled event<warn>This is required if `entityType` is 'STAGE_INSTANCE' or `VOICE`</warn>

props.name: entityMetadata
props.description: The entity metadata of theguild scheduled event<warn>This is required if `entityType` is 'EXTERNAL'</warn>

props.name: image
props.description: The cover image of the guild scheduled event

props.name: reason
props.description: The reason for creating the guild scheduled event

props.name: recurrenceRule
props.description: The recurrence rule of the guild scheduled event

typedefs.name: GuildScheduledEventEntityMetadataOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to set entity metadata of a guild scheduled event.

props.name: location
props.description: The location of the guild scheduled event<warn>This is required if `entityType` is 'EXTERNAL'</warn>

props.name: withUserCount

props.description: The scheduled entity type of the event

typedefs.name: GuildStickerCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options for creating a guild sticker.

props.name: description
props.description: The description for the sticker

props.name: reason
props.description: Reason for creating the sticker

typedefs.name: StickerResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Sticker object. This can be:* A Sticker object* A Snowflake

typedefs.name: GuildTextThreadCreateOptions
typedefs.description: Options for creating a thread. <warn>Only one of `startMessage` or `type` can be defined.</warn>

props.name: startMessage
props.description: The message to start a thread from. <warn>If this is defined then typeof thread gets automatically defined and cannot be changed. The provided `type` field will be ignored</warn>

props.name: type
props.description: The type of thread to create. Defaults to `GUILD_PUBLIC_THREAD` ifcreated in a {@link TextChannel} <warn>When creating threads in a {@link NewsChannel} this is ignored and is always`GUILD_NEWS_THREAD`</warn>

typedefs.description: The Opcodes sent to the Gateway:* DISPATCH: 0* HEARTBEAT: 1* IDENTIFY: 2* STATUS_UPDATE: 3* VOICE_STATE_UPDATE: 4* VOICE_GUILD_PING: 5* RESUME: 6* RECONNECT: 7* REQUEST_GUILD_MEMBERS: 8* INVALID_SESSION: 9* HELLO: 10* HEARTBEAT_ACK: 11* GUILD_SYNC: 12 [Unused]* DM_UPDATE: 13 #  Send => used to get dm features* GUILD_SUBSCRIPTIONS: 14 #  Send => discord responds back with GUILD_MEMBER_LIST_UPDATE type SYNC...* LOBBY_CONNECT: 15* LOBBY_DISCONNECT: 16* LOBBY_VOICE_STATE_UPDATE: 17 #  Receive* STREAM_CREATE: 18* STREAM_DELETE: 19* STREAM_WATCH: 20* STREAM_PING: 21 #  Send* STREAM_SET_PAUSED: 22* LFG_SUBSCRIPTIONS: 23 [Unused]* REQUEST_GUILD_APPLICATION_COMMANDS: 24 [Unused]* EMBEDDED_ACTIVITY_LAUNCH: 25 => Launch an embedded activity in a voice channel or call.* EMBEDDED_ACTIVITY_CLOSE: 26 => Stop an embedded activity.* EMBEDDED_ACTIVITY_UPDATE: 27 => Update an embedded activity.* REQUEST_FORUM_UNREADS: 28 => Request forum channel unread counts.* REMOTE_COMMAND: 29 => Send a remote command to an embedded (Xbox, PlayStation) voice session.* GET_DELETED_ENTITY_IDS_NOT_MATCHING_HASH: 30 => Request deleted entity IDs not matching a given hash for a guild.* REQUEST_SOUNDBOARD_SOUNDS: 31* SPEED_TEST_CREATE: 32 => Create a voice speed test.* SPEED_TEST_DELETE: 33 => Delete a voice speed test.* REQUEST_LAST_MESSAGES: 34 => Request last messages for a guild's channels.* SEARCH_RECENT_MEMBERS: 35 => ~ Opcode 8 (Member Safety)* REQUEST_CHANNEL_STATUSES: 36 => Request Voice Channel status.* GUILD_SUBSCRIPTIONS_BULK: 37 => ~ Opcode 14

typedefs.name: InviteScope
typedefs.description: A valid scope to request when generating an invite link.<warn>Scopes that require whitelist are not considered valid for this generator</warn>* `applications.builds.read`: allows reading build data for a users applications* `applications.commands`: allows this bot to create commands in the server* `applications.entitlements`: allows reading entitlements for a users applications* `applications.store.update`: allows reading and updating of store data for a users applications* `bot`: makes the bot join the selected guild* `connections`: makes the endpoint for getting a users connections available* `email`: allows the `/users/@me` endpoint return with an email* `identify`: allows the `/users/@me` endpoint without an email* `guilds`: makes the `/users/@me/guilds` endpoint available for a user* `guilds.join`: allows the bot to join the user to any guild it is in using Guild#addMember* `gdm.join`: allows joining the user to a group dm* `webhook.incoming`: generates a webhook to a channel* `role_connections.write`: allows your app to update a user's connection and metadata for the app

typedefs.name: IntegrationExpireBehavior
typedefs.description: The behavior of expiring subscribers for Integrations. This can be:* REMOVE_ROLE* KICK

typedefs.name: MessageReferenceType
typedefs.description: The type of a message reference, e.g. `DEFAULT`. Here are the available types:* DEFAULT* FORWARD

typedefs.name: SweeperKey
typedefs.description: The name of an item to be swept in Sweepers* `applicationCommands` - both global and guild commands* `autoModerationRules`* `bans`* `emojis`* `invites` - accepts the `lifetime` property, using it will sweep based on expires timestamp* `guildMembers`* `messages` - accepts the `lifetime` property, using it will sweep based on edited or created timestamp* `presences`* `reactions`* `stageInstances`* `stickers`* `threadMembers`* `threads` - accepts the `lifetime` property, using it will sweep archived threads based on archived timestamp* `users`* `voiceStates`

typedefs.name: SystemMessageType
typedefs.description: The types of messages that are `System`. The available types are `MessageTypes` excluding:* DEFAULT* REPLY* APPLICATION_COMMAND* CONTEXT_MENU_COMMAND

typedefs.name: ActivityType
typedefs.description: <info>Bots cannot set a `CUSTOM` activity type, it is only for custom statuses received from users</info>The type of an activity of a user's presence. Here are the available types:* PLAYING* STREAMING* LISTENING* WATCHING* CUSTOM* COMPETING* HANG

typedefs.name: ChannelType
typedefs.description: All available channel types:* `GUILD_TEXT` - a guild text channel* `DM` - a DM channel* `GUILD_VOICE` - a guild voice channel* `GROUP_DM` - a group DM channel* `GUILD_CATEGORY` - a guild category channel* `GUILD_NEWS` - a guild news channel* `GUILD_STORE` - a guild store channel<warn>Store channels are deprecated and will be removed from Discord in March 2022. See[Self-serve Game Selling Deprecation](https://support-dev.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/6309018858647)for more information.</warn>* `GUILD_NEWS_THREAD` - a guild news channel's public thread channel* `GUILD_PUBLIC_THREAD` - a guild text channel's public thread channel* `GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD` - a guild text channel's private thread channel* `GUILD_STAGE_VOICE` - a guild stage voice channel* `GUILD_DIRECTORY` - the channel in a hub containing guilds* `GUILD_FORUM` - a channel that can only contain threads* `GUILD_MEDIA` - a channel that can only contain threads, similar to `GUILD_FORUM` channels* `UNKNOWN` - a generic channel of unknown type, could be Channel or GuildChannel

typedefs.description: The premium tier (Server Boost level) of a guild:* NONE* TIER_1* TIER_2* TIER_3

typedefs.name: GuildScheduledEventStatus
typedefs.description: The status of a {@link GuildScheduledEvent}:* SCHEDULED* ACTIVE* COMPLETED* CANCELED

typedefs.name: GuildScheduledEventEntityType
typedefs.description: The entity type of a {@link GuildScheduledEvent}:* NONE* STAGE_INSTANCE* VOICE* EXTERNAL

typedefs.name: VideoQualityMode
typedefs.description: The camera video quality mode of a {@link VoiceChannel}:* AUTO* FULL

typedefs.name: ReactionType
typedefs.description: The type of reaction* NORMAL* BURST

typedefs.name: SortOrderType
typedefs.description: Sort {@link ThreadOnlyChannel} posts by creation time or activity* LATEST_ACTIVITY* CREATION_DATE

typedefs.name: ForumLayoutType
typedefs.description: The default forum layout to set on the {@link ForumChannel}* NOT_SET* LIST_VIEW* GALLERY_VIEW

typedefs.name: PollLayoutType
typedefs.description: Different layouts for {@link MessagePoll} will come in the future. For now though, this value will always be `DEFAULT`.* DEFAULT* IMAGE_ONLY_ANSWERS

typedefs.name: RelationshipType
typedefs.description: Relationship Enums:* 0: NONE* 1: FRIEND* 2: BLOCKED* 3: PENDING_INCOMING* 4: PENDING_OUTGOING* 5: IMPLICIT

typedefs.name: GuildTemplateResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a template code. This can be:* A template code* A template URL

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description: Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:* A Buffer* A base64 string

typedefs.name: BufferResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:* A Buffer* The path to a local file* A URL <warn>When provided a URL, discord.js will fetch the URL internally in order to create a Buffer.This can pose a security risk when the URL has not been sanitized</warn>

typedefs.name: TimestampStylesString
typedefs.description: A message formatting timestamp style, as defined in[here](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#message-formatting-timestamp-styles).* `t` Short time format, consisting of hours and minutes, e.g. 16:20.* `T` Long time format, consisting of hours, minutes, and seconds, e.g. 16:20:30.* `d` Short date format, consisting of day, month, and year, e.g. 20/04/2021.* `D` Long date format, consisting of day, month, and year, e.g. 20 April 2021.* `f` Short date-time format, consisting of short date and short time formats, e.g. 20 April 2021 16:20.* `F` Long date-time format, consisting of long date and short time formats, e.g. Tuesday, 20 April 2021 16:20.* `R` Relative time format, consisting of a relative duration format, e.g. 2 months ago.

typedefs.name: GuildMemberFlagsResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a guild member flag bitfield. This can be:* A string (see {@link GuildMemberFlags.FLAGS})* A guild member flag* An instance of GuildMemberFlags* An Array of GuildMemberFlagsResolvable

typedefs.name: IntentsResolvable
typedefs.description: Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:* A string (see {@link Intents.FLAGS})* An intents flag* An instance of Intents* An array of IntentsResolvable

returns.description: Return `null` to skip sweeping, otherwise a function passed to `sweep()`,See {@link [Collection#sweep](https://discord.js.org/docs/packages/collection/stable/Collection:Class#sweep)}for the definition of this function.

typedefs.name: LimitedCollectionOptions
typedefs.description: Options for defining the behavior of a LimitedCollection

props.name: maxSize
props.description: The maximum size of the Collection

props.name: keepOverLimit
props.description: A function, which is passed the value and key of an entry, ran to decideto keep an entry past the maximum size

props.name: sweepFilter
props.description: DEPRECATED: There is no direct alternative to this,however most of its purpose is fulfilled by {@link Client#sweepers}A function ran every `sweepInterval` to determine how to sweep

props.name: sweepInterval
props.description: DEPRECATED: There is no direct alternative to this,however most of its purpose is fulfilled by {@link Client#sweepers}How frequently, in seconds, to sweep the collection.

typedefs.name: RateLimitData
typedefs.description: Rate limit data

props.name: timeout
props.description: Time until this rate limit ends, in milliseconds

props.name: limit
props.description: The maximum amount of requests of this endpoint

props.name: method
props.description: The HTTP method of this request

props.name: path
props.description: The path of the request relative to the HTTP endpoint

props.name: route
props.description: The route of the request relative to the HTTP endpoint

props.name: global
props.description: Whether this is a global rate limit

typedefs.name: RateLimitQueueFilter
typedefs.description: Whether this rate limit should throw an Error

params.name: rateLimitData
params.description: The data of this rate limit

params.name: manager
params.description: The manager class the cache is being requested from.

params.name: holds
params.description: The class that the cache will hold.

returns.description: A Collection used to store the cache of the manager.
HCaptcha Token

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description: Options for a client.

props.name: DMChannelVoiceStatusSync
props.description: The amount of time in milliseconds that the Client to register the event with each DM channel (0=Disable)

props.name: captchaRetryLimit
props.description: Captcha retry limit

props.name: captchaSolver
props.description: Captcha Solver

props.name: TOTPKey
props.description: TOTP key / 2FA Key for two-factor authenticationThis is a 32-character Base32 string (excluding spaces), typically shown only once during your 2FA setup (QR code), or in the "Manual Entry" section.The library automatically removes spaces and converts the secret to uppercase.Example value: 'ftc3 uz6q 5lpw 2kew 4thr vtyp n2cu topn' or 'WSLIVE6EKYSRMVRBZLFGG2KVIVJMMQY5'

props.name: closeTimeout
props.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the close frame to be receivedfrom the WebSocket.<info>Don't have this too high/low. It's best to have it between 2000-6000 ms.</info>(e.g. recommended shard count, shard count of the ShardingManager)

props.name: makeCache
props.description: Function to create a cache.You can use your own function, or the {@link Options} class to customize the Collection used for the cache.<warn>Overriding the cache used in `GuildManager`, `ChannelManager`, `GuildChannelManager`, `RoleManager`,and `PermissionOverwriteManager` is unsupported and **will** break functionality</warn>

props.name: messageCacheLifetime
props.description: DEPRECATED: Pass `lifetime` to `sweepers.messages` instead.How long a message should stay in the cache until it is considered sweepable (in seconds, 0 for forever)

props.name: messageSweepInterval
props.description: DEPRECATED: Pass `interval` to `sweepers.messages` instead.How frequently to remove messages from the cache that are older than the message cache lifetime(in seconds, 0 for never)

props.name: allowedMentions
props.description: Default value for {@link MessageOptions#allowedMentions}

props.name: invalidRequestWarningInterval
props.description: The number of invalid REST requests (those that return401, 403, or 429) in a 10 minute window between emitted warnings (0 for no warnings). That is, if set to 500,warnings will be emitted at invalid request number 500, 1000, 1500, and so on.

props.name: partials
props.description: Structures allowed to be partial. This means events can be emitted even whenthey're missing all the data for a particular structure. See the "Partial Structures" topic on the[guide](https://discordjs.guide/popular-topics/partials.html) for someimportant usage information, as partials require you to put checks in place when handling data.

props.name: restWsBridgeTimeout
props.description: Maximum time permitted between REST responses and theircorresponding WebSocket events

props.name: restTimeOffset
props.description: Extra time in milliseconds to wait before continuing to make RESTrequests (higher values will reduce rate-limiting errors on bad connections)

props.name: restRequestTimeout
props.description: Time to wait before cancelling a REST request, in milliseconds

props.name: restSweepInterval
props.description: How frequently to delete inactive request buckets, in seconds(or 0 for never)

props.name: restGlobalRateLimit
props.description: How many requests to allow sending per second (0 for unlimited, 50 forthe standard global limit used by Discord)

props.name: rejectOnRateLimit
props.description: Decides how rate limits and pre-emptive throttlesshould be handled. If this option is an array containing the prefix of the request route (e.g. /channels to match anyroute starting with /channels, such as /channels/222197033908436994/messages) or a function returning true, a{@link RateLimitError} will be thrown. Otherwise the request will be queued for later

props.name: retryLimit
props.description: How many times to retry on 5XX errors(Infinity for an indefinite amount of retries)

props.name: failIfNotExists
props.description: Default value for {@link ReplyMessageOptions#failIfNotExists}

props.name: presence
props.description: Presence data to use upon login

props.name: waitGuildTimeout
props.description: Time in milliseconds that Clients with the GUILDS intent should wait formissing guilds to be received before starting the bot. If not specified, the default is 15 seconds.

props.name: sweepers
props.description: Options for cache sweeping

props.name: ws
props.description: Options for the WebSocket

props.name: http
props.description: HTTP options

typedefs.name: SweeperOptions
typedefs.description: Options for {@link Sweepers} defining the behavior of cache sweeping

typedefs.name: SweepOptions
typedefs.description: Options for sweeping a single type of item from cache

props.name: interval
props.description: The interval (in seconds) at which to perform sweeping of the item

props.name: lifetime
props.description: How long an item should stay in cache until it is considered sweepable.<warn>This property is only valid for the `invites`, `messages`, and `threads` keys. The `filter` propertyis mutually exclusive to this property and takes priority</warn>

props.name: filter
props.description: The function used to determine the function passed to the sweep method<info>This property is optional when the key is `invites`, `messages`, or `threads` and `lifetime` is set</info>

props.name: properties

typedefs.name: Snowflake
typedefs.description: A {@link https://docs.x.com/resources/fundamentals/x-ids Twitter snowflake},except the epoch is 2015-01-01T00:00:00.000Z.If we have a snowflake '266241948824764416' we can represent it as binary:```64                                          22     17     12          0 000000111011000111100001101001000101000000  00001  00000  000000000000 number of milliseconds since Discord epoch  worker  pid    increment```

typedefs.name: DeconstructedSnowflake
typedefs.description: A deconstructed snowflake.

props.name: timestamp
props.description: Timestamp the snowflake was created

props.name: date
props.description: Date the snowflake was created

props.name: workerId
props.description: The worker's id in the snowflake

props.name: processId
props.description: The process's id in the snowflake

props.name: increment
props.description: Increment in the snowflake

props.name: binary
props.description: Binary representation of the snowflake

returns.description: Return `null` to skip sweeping, otherwise a function passed to `sweep()`,See {@link [Collection#sweep](https://discord.js.org/docs/packages/collection/stable/Collection:Class#sweep)}for the definition of this function.

typedefs.name: LifetimeFilterOptions
typedefs.description: Options for generating a filter function based on lifetime

props.name: lifetime
props.description: How long, in seconds, an entry should stay in the collectionbefore it is considered sweepable.

props.name: getComparisonTimestamp
props.description: A function that takes an entry, key,and the collection and returns a timestamp to compare against in order to determine the lifetime of the entry.

props.name: excludeFromSweep
props.description: A function that takes an entry, key, and the collectionand returns a boolean, `true` when the entry should not be checked for sweepability.
